review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Anby Demara, often called Stun Anby to differentiate her from her S-rank Soldier 0 counterpart, is a free A-Rank Electric Stun Agent available right from the get-go","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" whose main role is to deal a lot of Daze to enemies in a short amount of field time in order to offer Stun windows for your other Agents to exploit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Anby is a character who’s very conceptually simple to get a good grasp on","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Overall, being a free character you get right from the start of the game, Anby is a character who portrays the phrase “simple yet effective” perfectly. There are some minor intricacies to her kit, but once you get a grasp of her 2 main combos (which really doesn’t take long to do), it becomes very difficult to play her incorrectly, which is one of her biggest strengths.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When it comes to explaining her kit, we’ll keep things as short as we can because it’s really simple to grasp:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Chain and Ultimate are simple bursts of DMG and Daze with no intricacies to them, the same applies to her Quick Assist, and her Defensive Assist is a simple big burst of Daze that should be executed along with her Assist Follow-Up when possible to stun enemies faster.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anby’s Basic Attack and EX Special are generally tied together, they’re the two main components of Anby’s combo. After the third hit of Anby’s Basic Attack, she can follow up with a special Basic Attack called “Thunderbolt” by holding down the Basic Attack button or by pausing for a split second then pressing Basic again (it’s easier and doesn’t cause any losses to simply hold the Basic Attack button, so typically that’s what you’ll do).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her EX Special is another big burst of damage and Daze that costs 60 Energy and is also usable after her Basic P3 for a faster start-up, after which she can immediately follow up with her Thunderbolt Basic Attack by simply tapping the Basic Attack input, allowing for a very quick burst of Daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Executing either of these actions after Basic P3 allows Anby, via her Core Passive, to gain up to 64% extra Daze on them. This means when you have enough Energy available you can execute this combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P1","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P2","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Thunderbolt","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The EX Special gains 64% extra Daze doing this via Anby’s Core Passive, which is extremely valuable to stun enemies quickly. However, if you don’t have the Energy required to perform an EX Special, simply perform this combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P1","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P2","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Thunderbolt","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hold Basic Attack after Basic P3 to perform Thunderbolt here, which gains an extra 64% Daze via Anby’s Core Passive. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Some intricacies to mention include the following:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Try to use Anby’s Ultimate whenever possible and out of a Stun window to create more Stun opportunities for your team; ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anby’s Dodge Counter is very powerful and should be executed whenever possible (even interrupting your combo for it), this grants her extra Energy with her Additional Ability activated;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"If you can perform a Defensive Assist with Anby, it’s never a bad idea to do so to stun enemies quicker;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anby’s Basic P4 can be used instead of standard combos every 30s by simply repeatedly tapping Basic Attack to get extra Energy Regen from her M1.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Finally, simply repeat the above actions until the enemy is stunned, then chain into your DPS Agent for big bursts of damage. Make sure to have Anby’s Additional Ability condition satisfied for more EX Specials, which means faster Stuns!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"That sums up Anby’s gameplay in just about full detail, she’s really simplistic in essence. Her regular Special is unused as her Thunderbolt Basic is always more preferable to execute. Certain intricacies may apply depending on your specific team and the enemy you’re facing, however in terms of general usage this is as complex as it gets.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Regarding Anby’s meta relevancy, she’s always outclassed by at least one other Stun agent in any team, which is to be expected as she’s a free character obtained at the very beginning of the game","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". The biggest example of this is Qingyi, being another Electric Stun Agent who wants to stay on the field, stuns quickly, and applies Stun DMG Multiplier debuffs, outclassing Anby in just about every way. However, to Anby’s credit, for the character you start the game with, she very much doesn’t disappoint. Building her, even into the late game, should give you the resources you need to fully clear endgame content. She works as a “budget Qingyi” of sorts and while Anby doesn’t provide nearly as much as the robot policewoman does, she fills the same niche as her, slots in similar team compositions and remains effective nonetheless.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, Anby is a simplistic Stun Agent to play, build, and use, and while she’s a free character given at the very beginning of the game with little special qualities to make her stand out, she remains very suitable in her role thanks to her Daze and Damage numbers standing fairly strong to this day, especially at M6. She won’t disappoint if you wish to build her, however be aware that she will be outclassed by other Stun Agent options once you acquire them, so you may end up replacing her someday. But until that day comes, she’ll be very serviceable.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy combos to learn and execute with high daze potential and a simplistic onfielder playstyle;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High Energy generation built into her kit, even able to funnel flat Energy to other Electric characters;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Becomes stronger the more aggressive the enemy is, thanks to her Dodge Counter, while remaining usable at a baseline;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Surprisingly acceptable personal damage by Stun character standards, especially at M6;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’s free!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has little to no AoE potential unless enemies are on top of each other;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Provides very little value to other Agents as she has no extra buffs/debuffs like other Stun Agents do;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overshadowed in any team by one or more options, which makes her very easily replaceable.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Rapid Charge Mode
talents.desc: When the 4th-hit of Anby's Basic Attack hits an enemy, her Energy Generation Rate is increased by 12% for 30s.

talents.name: Precision Discharge
talents.desc: When Basic Attack: Thunderbolt hits a Stunned enemy, its DMG is increased by 30%. When Anby's EX Special Attack hits an enemy that is not Stunned, the Daze inflicted is increased by 10%.

talents.name: Well-Disciplined
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Conducting Charge
talents.desc: When Anby launches a Chain Attack or uses her Ultimate, off-field Electric Agents recover 3 Energy. For every 12% Energy Generation Anby Has, recover an additional 2 Energy, up to a maximum of 6.

talents.name: Street Experience
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Charging Field
talents.desc: When Anby uses her EX Special Attack, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When she hits an enemy with her Basic Attack or Dash Attack, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, increasing that attack's DMG by 45%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A mysterious young girl who never talks about her past, almost as if she didn't have one. She is calm and collected, and unusually competent and efficient in combat, almost as if she'd had years of training. In an unexpected incident, Nicole brought her back to the Cunning Hares, and she has an emotional independence on her ever since. She loves watching movies, but due to certain lack of common sense she seems to almost think them real-life stories.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soldier 0 Anby, or in short S0 Anby, is our first Limited S-Rank Electric Attack Agent and ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"makes a strong debut climbing to the top of the meta as a top tier DPS that’s not only effective but also simple & relatively easy to play","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"What makes S0 Anby unique is her focus on a new mechanic and damage type ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Aftershock, which revolves around dealing damage via triggers instead of directly through abilities","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Similar to how Burnice’s Afterburn works). To access instances of this unique damage type, Anby utilizes a fairly standard builder spender playstyle that culminates in a multi-dash attack sequence that triggers constant Aftershocks, the game plan is building and accessing these attacks as much as possible. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outside of Aftershock, S0 Anby’s kit only contains 1 unique mechanic - a 3-staged resource called “Silver Star” which takes the form of a 3 pointed star mark Anby slowly fills out until full. It can be accessed by striking an enemy with any of the following abilities:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attacks","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attacks","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Celestial Thunder","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Sundering Bolt","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Upon landing any of these attacks, S0 Anby will immediately mark the target and accumulate varying amounts of “Silver Star” on them. Each enemy can accumulate up to 99 “Silver Star” and upon reaching the thresholds of 33, 66 and 99 “Silver Stars” an additional point of the Star will be activated - a detail important for the rest of Anby’s kit!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Anby’s “Silver Star” serves two purposes. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first being allowing the repeated use of her combo based Special Attack, “Special Attack: Azure Flash” which triggers Aftershocks and makes up for a significant amount of her total damage. The second is to activate her Core Passive and Additional ability, both of which grant her a plethora of excellent passive buffs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Let's start with “Special Attack: Azure Flash” first, which is S0 Anby’s bread and butter.  After accumulating enough “Silver Star” to reach the breakpoints of 33/66/99 (aka filling up a point of the Star), that enemy will receive 1 stack of “White Flash”. When an enemy has “White Flash” tapping the Special Attack will consume a stack to make Anby perform a rapid dash that deals minor damage but triggers a powerful Electric Aftershock. With 3 points of the Star filled (A maxed out “Silver Star”), she can perform 3 of these dashes in quick succession. Doing this is highly recommended due to the next portion of her Special Attack “Special Attack: Thunder Smite”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Upon triggering 3 Aftershocks by consuming “White Flash” on an enemy, they’ll be struck with an additional even stronger Aftershock as a bonus. Because of this, Anby’s playstyle becomes quite simple, accumulate all 3 points of her “Silver Star” via various abilities to generate 3 “White Flash” on the enemy, then spend them by using 3 back to back “Azure Flash”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Accumulate maximum Silver Star","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Aftershock Damage triggers","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Aftershock Damage triggers","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Aftershock Damage triggers","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Thunder Smite Aftershock Damage triggers","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The other reason we’re accumulating “Silver Star” is of course due to S0 Anby’s Core Passive and Additional Ability mentioned earlier. Her Core Passive: Voltage Gap grants her 25% increased damage as well as a special 30% CRIT DMG multiplier to all her Aftershock damage whilst enemies are marked with her “Silver Star”. This CRIT DMG Multiplier isn’t simply a plain 30% additional CRIT DMG boost, instead it multiplies your existing CRIT DMG again! If you have 200% CRIT DMG your Aftershock CRIT DMG will be 260% (1.3 times stronger)! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"S0 Anby’s Additional ability requires a Stun or Support character to activate, a very easy requirement.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" While in effect S0 Anby gains a free 10% CRIT RATE and boosts the entire squad's Aftershock DMG by 25% against enemies with “Silver Star” while she’s the active agent. A nice pile of free stats that can benefit other Aftershock scaling allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The entirety of the remainder of her kit is all extremely basic and exists solely for the purpose of generating and refreshing her “Silver Star” as quickly as possible. Seriously, it's that simple. In the interest of completeness, let's quickly cover her remaining abilities before diving into her admittedly simple combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Basic attacks are one of the main ways you’ll be generating her “Silver Star” consistently and are composed of a 5 attack combo all consisting of Electric Damage. The one thing that makes this combo a little different is her ability to repeatedly use P4 of the Basic Attack up to 5 times in quick succession, something that is almost always worth doing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Dash Attack and Dodge counter are completely stock standard with the exception being that her Dodge Counter grants an abnormal amount of “Silver Star” accumulation making it one of the best ways to quickly build toward accessing her full “Azure Flash” combo. Also worth noting is that S0 Anby will immediately skip to Basic Attack P2 following a Dodge Counter. Whenever you can fit this ability in and you need “Silver Star” build-up use it!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outside of S0 Anby’s “Azure Flash” Special Attacks, Anby also has both an EX-Special and a standard Special Attack. The standard Special Attack doesn’t do much damage or have any bonus effects and thus isn’t worth using. The EX-Special can only be accessed by pressing and holding the Special Attack and will deal considerable damage, but more importantly, immediately accumulate a maximum “Silver Star” mark (even if you had 0 accumulated beforehand). This ability allows for excellent amounts of burst for S0 Anby and allows her to use 6 “Azure Flashes” in quick succession!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Accumulate maximum Silver Star","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Sundering Bolt","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Azure Flash","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Quick Assist, Assist Follow-Up and Chain Attack are all stock standard abilities outside of the fact they help accumulate her “Silver Star”. Her Ultimate however fully accumulates her Silver Star similar to her EX-Special skill,  allowing for even further combos when available!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"With all that covered, let's quickly cover Anby’s rotations of which there are two: non-stun and stun. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When playing S0 Anby outside of the stun window, simply make use of her standard Basic Attack sequence and Dodge Counters to accumulate fully charged “Silver Star” quickly to spend on “Azure Flashes”. 1 Dodge Counter followed by a full Basic Attack sequence is enough to fully charge a “Silver accumulating all of her resources for when the enemy is stunned in order to execute as many “Azure Flashes” as possible during the window of vulnerability. The key to maximising her damage in this rotation is saving your Energy, Decibels and ensuring you have a close to fully charged “Silver Star” available before the enemy is stunned. Build up an almost full “Silver Star” Mark then execute the following combo during the stun window:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Accumulate Silver Star above, there are two things worth noting. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first is to accurately gauge how much “Silver Star” accumulation you need before the stun window with the Chain Attack in mind. Fully accumulating a “Silver Star” Mark will waste any gained via the Chain Attack, thereby stopping just as you get enough with the Chain Attack in mind, will save you time. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second is that, similar to Evelyn, Anby can make use of the advanced tactic Chain Cancelling to perform two Chain Attacks per boss stun window instead of one. This allows her to deal more damage and gain more “Silver Star” accumulation making the first point even more potent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"And that about covers it, S0 Anby is simple, easy to play and deals outstanding damage making her a good choice for those looking to get stuff done without the stress of overly complex rotations.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" With that said, she isn’t without her flaws - the Electric damage type already has a number of excellent and even free DPS, if you already enjoy their playstyles and have them built, she might not be as valuable to you. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In addition to this, S0 Anby isn’t quite as potent in AoE fights as some of her peers such as Evelyn or Miyabi are, giving them a slight edge over her in some encounters. With that said S0 Anby is certainly a powerhouse at the top of the meta at the time of her release and an agent to consider for those she appeals to.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Static Charge
talents.desc: When Soldier 0 - Anby uses an EX Special Attack to hit an enemy, it triggers the additional DMG from White Thunder 3 times. This effect does not consume any White Thunder stacks.

talents.name: Fail-Safe Protocol
talents.desc: Soldier 0 - Anby's CRIT Rate increases by 12%. When she uses her Ultimate, she gains 6 stacks of Thunder's Cry (max 6 stacks). With Thunder's Cry, when using Special Attack: Azure Flash to hit an enemy with White Thunder, it will consume 1 stack of Thunder's Cry instead. Only 1 stack of Thunder's Cry will be consumed when a single use of a skill hits multiple enemies, and consuming Thunder's Cry will still activate the additional DMG from White Thunder.

talents.name: Past Glory
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Silver Reverb
talents.desc: When hitting an enemy marked with Silver Star, Soldier 0 - Anby ignores 12% of the target's Electric RES.

talents.name: Director's Cut
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Prequel Protagonist
talents.desc: Upon triggering 6 instances of White Thunder's additional DMG, an electromagnetic vortex will be generated, dealing 1,000% of Soldier 0 - Anby's ATK as Electric DMG. This DMG is considered Aftershock DMG.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the unique mechanic to retrigger Shocks every 0.5 seconds after dealing 4 Critical Hits while in Burst mode giving him one of the highest potential kits for an A-rank unit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has great Mindscapes, giving him good scaling potential as you develop your account. His M1 prolongs his Burst Mode duration by a good amount, and his M4 gives the whole team a Crit Rate buff after he uses a Chain or Ultimate attack for 12 seconds.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is a Bro.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a large amount of his potential damage within his kit tied to his ability to trigger additional damage against Shocked enemies, making him reliant on ensuring enemies remain Shocked as much as possible and for as large amount of damage as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has limited options outside of S-rank’s when it comes to team building.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies heavily on being in Burst Mode to deal the majority of his damage and feels lackluster outside of it, making Anton one of the most energy-reliant characters in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2300-2800+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"9000+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"70-100%","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"120-160%+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Warm-up Exercises
talents.desc: When Drill Attack hits an enemy, Anton gains additional Energy up to a maximum of 5 Energy per skill use.

talents.name: State of Flow
talents.desc: When Anton uses his EX Special Attack and enters Burst Mode, he gains a Shield that equals to 7.5% of his max HP. While in Burst Mode, entering combat or switching in reapplies the Shield effect. This effect can trigger once every 15s. The Shield dissipates when Burst Mode ends.

talents.name: Rotational Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Everyone Get Fired Up!
talents.desc: When Anton uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, all squad members' CRIT Rate increases by 10% for 12s.

talents.name: Jack of All Trades
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Break the Limit
talents.desc: When Anton's Piledriver Attack triggers a critical hit, his Basic Attack: Enthusiastic Drills (Burst Mode) and Dodge Counter: Overload Drill (Burst Mode) deal 4% more DMG for 30s, stacking up to 6 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leads Others in His Passion for Work. A senior staff member of Belobog Industries, he's an onsite project manager who's always ready to go. Energetic and Reliable. He's full of vigor and always rises to the occasion. Kind-Hearted Despite Appearances. With a sharp tongue but a soft heart, he can't say \"no\" to those in need. Strong, Sincere & Straightforward. Open and honest, nothing can seem to upset him.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Astra Yao is a S-Rank Ranged Ether Support Agent wielding a microphone and the power of her voice to buff allies and deal a bit of damage herself. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As the first Limited Support unit, it’s no surprise that Astra’s buffs take things to the next level and set a new bar for team-wide boosts. With that said she is more than just a buff machine as she brings her own unique playstyle to the game, thanks to her powerful but somewhat unusual kit. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra is all about her Special Attack, an ability that renders her immobile and mostly inactive by placing her in a special singing state called “Idyllic Cadenza”. In this state, she remains on the field even when swapped off  (is invulnerable for the duration), buffs allies, and allows them to expend her energy to trigger Quick Assists on demand taking the concept of “Quick-Swap” to an entirely new level. If all of that sounds a bit strange and maybe a bit too simple you’d be right so let's get into more detail.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her kit is wordy and doesn’t read like a traditional character’s kit due to the nature of her “Idyllic Cadenza” state, but have no fear! ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"She is in fact the simplest character to play in the entire game (and it’s not close), with her gameplay boiling down to the following:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Special Attack to enter the “Idyllic Cadenza” state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Chain Attack when available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Ultimate when it makes sense.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"And that’s it... There is no “traditional rotation” with her and whilst there are other actions you can perform such as Basic Attacks and Dodges, it’s usually not needed. With that said, while “How to Play” Astra is simple, understanding what she’s doing and her effects on teams is less so, and quite important to making full of her. And as such, it’s time to dive into the nitty gritty of her kit!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her unique resource gauge is “Chords” which unlike other character’s resources doesn’t require you to do anything special to accumulate. “Chords” are simply a representation of her current energy for the purpose of tracking her potential ability usage more easily. For every 25 energy she has,  it will show up as having 1 “Chord”, thus 100 energy = 4 “Chords”. Spending 25 of that on an ability will consume 1 “Chord” worth of energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"First and most important of Astra’s abilities is her Special Attack which notably has no EX-Special alternative and Astra will be using that energy for something else. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using the Special Attack causes the following effects to happen all at once:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra enters the “Idyllic Cadenza” state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra performs an attack called Tremolo.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She can optionally choose to press and hold to charge the Special Attack. Doing so draws enemies toward Astra and increases the Tremeloes triggered from the typically 1 up to a maximum of 4 instead (dependent on charge duration).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She triggers a Quick Assist in the same way as all other Support’s Special Attacks (Can be converted to a “Precise Assist”).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Tremolo is a special damage source triggered by multiple of Astra’s abilities, it deals a small amount of Ether DMG, but most importantly is considered EX-Special DMG which is important for the purpose of many W-Engine effects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state Astra gains access to a myriad of buffs, mechanics and ability changes. To get started and keep things simple here is a quick list of all of them:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Becomes immobile outside of Dashing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains Anti-Interrupt Level and takes 40% reduced damage while on field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains the ability to remain on the field in an Invulnerable state when switched out maintaining “Idyllic Cadenza” while not being the active Agent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants all squad members 20% DMG and 25% CRIT DMG.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Enables Squad Members to trigger “Precise Assists” and gain access to Quick Assists at non-standard times.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Out of all of these, the last one is the one that needs explaining. While in “Idyllic Cadenza” state and having at least 1 “Chord”, whenever the on-field agent executes:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A hit on an enemy (CD: 3s).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A Heavy Attack on an enemy (CD: 1s).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She will grant that Agent a Quick Assist between them and your team's other Agent (not being Astra) immediately followed by a “Precise Assist” trigger and the “Chord” consumption related to it. Triggering Quick Assists in this way, follow the cooldowns listed above for their respective attack types.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Precise Assists” trigger whenever any squad mate performs a:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Defensive Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Evasive Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"And Astra has access to a “Chord” (25 energy). Triggering a “Precise Assist\" consumes the “Chord” and causes Astra to launch 1 Tremolo (the same one as the initial cast of her Special Attack) followed immediately by 3 “Tone Clusters” which deal a small amount of Ether DMG each for even more damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Astra can remain in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state indefinitely even if her energy reaches 0 - a fact that many players take advantage of by using her ability at the start of battle and only ever switching back to her to use her Ultimate or Chain Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra’s Additional Ability and Core Passive directly build on her Special Attack and “Idyllic Cadenza” state enhancing it further. Her Core Passive: “Graceful Andante” allows her to grant 35% of her own ATK as additional Flat ATK to both herself and any character that switches in after triggering a “Precise Assist” up to a cap of 1200 Flat ATK (Requires roughly 3430 ATK to max out at M0). Assuming you’re playing Astra normally and constantly alternating between your other two agents via Quick Assists you’ll have no issues maintaining this buff on your entire team indefinitely.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whereas, while Active, her Additional Ability: “Moonlit Frenzy” causes her Tremolo and 3 Tone Clusters to double trigger every time a “Chord” is consumed, doubling her damage output from “Precise Assist” triggers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra’s Chain Attack is a stock standard Ether DMG attack but her Ultimate is something special. Upon use, her Ultimate heals all squad members up to 2950 HP and causes the next two Quick Assists Astra grants to be Chain Attacks instead. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"With this Astra is ZZZ’s very first Healer and can also open up new potential combos with characters having particularly impactful Chain Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Because her role in battle is to remain in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state, off the field for almost all of the combat, it should be no surprise that her Basic Attacks, Dodge Attacks, and Assists aren’t of too much relevance or used that frequently. With that said her Dodge can be used to reposition if you end up with her as your active Agent and her Basic Attack can be pressed and held to perform an attack that causes her to exit the “Idyllic Cadenza” state. Some of her abilities in these categories also gain different versions while within “Idyllic Cadenza” state but aren’t impactful on her role as a Support and as a result aren’t frequently used.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In conclusion, Astra is perhaps one of the simplest characters to play in the game but also is someone who has some of the highest impact on teams she's present in.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Astra teams are effectively 2 Agent teams as Astra is almost exclusively off-field buffing and offering her Quick Assists. While this playstyle is competitive it certainly won't be for everyone. It also heavily relies on the fact that those 2 Agents are strong enough to carry the extra weight. Ultimately, Astra has some of the best buffs in the game, offers a new twist on combat and team building and is a top tier meta choice at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Universal support that can be played in almost any team composition.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Buffs affect the whole team, offering even greater power to double DPS teams than other supports.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Provides healing to teammates which is useful for content where sustain is relevant.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Allows incredibly frequent use of Quick Assissts and the use of Chain attack outside of stun windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Provides an incredible array of buffs, including one of the highest ATK buffs in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not reliant on her Signature W-Engine to perform well.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Effectively locks you into a 2 active Agent playstyle, due to her low field time playstyle - while competitive, it won't be for everyone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a part of the new \"Stars of Lyra\", no current DPS characters share her faction which can make building teams with older characters awkward.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"3430+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra requires at minimum ~3430 ATK to get the maximum effect out of her Core Skill team-wide buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Because of the potency of this buff, reaching this ATK breakpoint is the most important thing Astra can do with her Set Bonus, Main Stats, Sub Stats, and W-Engine choice. Use each of these methods to stack ATK until you have enough.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10500+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Energy Regen: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"0 - 130%","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Dependant on Secondary Disc Set, Disc Main Stat and W-Engine)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gaining more ER is equivalent to gaining more free Quick Assists. Because of this getting as much Energy Regen as possible is very beneficial and picking it up whenever it doesn't interfere with you reaching 3430 ATK or more is a top priority.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After achieving or exceeding all the stat goals above, you can aim to maximize Astra's damage potential by either stacking CRIT or Anomaly (","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"not both","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":") - any amount of either of the offensive stats is beneficial.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"OR","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anomaly Proficiency: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT [ATK% > Flat ATK (Top Priorities Until Ability Cap) > CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG  > PEN] or ANOMALY [ATK% > Flat ATK (Top Priorities Until Ability Cap) > Anomaly Proficiency  > PEN]

talents.name: 12-Tone Equal Temperament
talents.desc: When Astra Yao's attack hits an enemy, the target's All-Attribute RES is reduced by 6%, stacking up to 3 times and lasting 30s. Repeated triggers refresh the duration. Upon entering the battlefield, Astra Yao immediately gains 1,000 Decibels. When activating her Ultimate, all squad members gain 1 stack of Song of Protection for 60s. When attacked by an enemy, consume Song of Protection, granting Invulnerability for 1s.

talents.name: Art of Greed
talents.desc: The ATK buff from Core Passive: Graceful Andante is further increased by 19%, with an increased maximum of 400. While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, when other characters switch in through a Quick Assist, Chain Attack, Defensive Assist, or Evasive Assist, Astra Yao will additionally follow up with 1 Tremolo and 3 Tone Clusters to attack. This effect can trigger once every 3s.

talents.name: Interwoven Staff Notation
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Hair Upon Your Nape
talents.desc: After activating a Chain Attack or Ultimate, within 15s, Astra Yao can trigger a Quick Assist even if she does not have Chords. When the attack hits an enemy, the interval for triggering a Quick Assist is reduced to 1s. While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, when other characters enter the field via a Quick Assist, they will receive different buffs based on their specialty, and this effect can be triggered once every 3s for the entire squad: Attack: The next Quick Assist heavy attack on an enemy will deal extra DMG equal to 300% of Astra Yao's ATK; Anomaly: The next Quick Assist will have 50% increased Anomaly Buildup; Stun: The next Quick Assist will inflict 50% increased Daze.

talents.name: Proxy and Silk String
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: We Are the World
talents.desc: While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, the DMG multiplier for Tremolo and Tone Clusters released or followed up with will increase to 200% of the original, and CRIT Rate is increased by 80%. When triggering a Precise Assist, Astra Yao will automatically follow up with the charged 3rd-hit of Basic Attack: Capriccio, with a 80% increased CRIT Rate. This effect can trigger once every 10s.

talents.name: Reacting Force
talents.desc: When successfully Blocking an enemy with Ben's Special Attack or EX Special Attack, the DMG dealt by the blocked enemy is reduced by 30% for 15s.

talents.name: Offense Through Defense
talents.desc: When successfully triggering a Block Counter during Ben's Special Attack or EX Special Attack, inflict an additional 300% of Ben's DEF as DMG.

talents.name: Careful Accounting
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Agile Adaptation
talents.desc: When successfully blocking enemy DMG with Ben’s invulnerable effect during his Special Attack or EX Special Attack, the following counter deals 30% more DMG.

talents.name: Meticulous Detail
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Wild spirit
talents.desc: After launching an attack or follow-up attack during Ben's EX Special Attack, Daze inflicted by Basic Attacks, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter is increased by 20%, lasting 12s.

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Dazzling Entrance
talents.desc: When Billy hits an enemy with a Dash Attack or Dodge Counter, he gains an additional 2.7 Energy. Can trigger once every 5s.

talents.name: Roaming Gunslinger
talents.desc: Billy's Dodge Counter DMG increases by 25%. Rolling Shots during his Basic Attacks count as dodges, making Billy Invulnerable during skill activation and able to trigger Perfect Dodges. When a Rolling Shot triggers a Perfect Dodge, it will automatically follow up a Dodge Counter.

talents.name: Teachings of the Starlight Knights
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Starlight Ballistics
talents.desc: When Billy hits an enemy with his EX Special Attack, the skill's CRIT Rate increases based on the distance from the enemy. The closer he is to the target, the greater the effect, up to a maximum increase of 32%.

talents.name: Lost Technological Construct
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Starlight Hero
talents.desc: When Billy accumulates 10 hits on enemies or triggers a Perfect Dodge, his DMG increases by 6%, stacking up to 5 times. The effect resets is he is knocked back or launched by an enemy.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A handsome cyborg with a casual and carefree personality. He's an avid fan of the Starlight Knight show, not only referring to himself as one of the Starlight Knights, but repeating many classic lines from the show. Refers to his pair of special custom-made high-caliber revolvers as \"the girls\". They appear to have been a gift from an old friend. He may look unreliable, but once he gets serious Billy can take on any challenge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice is a S-Rank Melee Fire Anomaly Agent who brings forth a unique playstyle of passively dealing a good part of her damage and Anomaly Buildup while being off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Complimenting this, she doesn’t require much time on-field in first place, and to no surprise of anyone, being an Anomaly character she excels at applying and amplifying Burn Disorder quickly and consistently - making her a top choice for Anomaly/Disorder teams, especially ones with characters who can take up the field-time Burnice doesn’t really require. To understand exactly what makes this Pyromaniac cyclist work let's dive into her playstyle and kit! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her play style primarily focuses on marking enemies with her special “Scorch” status and building & utilizing her special resource “Heat” - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"all the while taking minimal field time and using her most powerful abilities to apply massive amounts of Fire Anomaly. Enemies that are Scorched by Burnice suffer great damage and Anomaly when hit by any squad member other than Burnice. That's possible thanks to her Core Passive (that works even when she's off-field) at the cost of consuming her “Heat” count slightly. Continuously triggering Afterburn on Scorched targets is her game plan and in order to do the same she needs to build and maintain a good amount of “Heat” consistently. It can be achieved by either using her Ultimate or spending energy. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This leads to a gameplay loop of Scorching the enemies, building and maintaining “Heat” with EX-Special/Ultimate, and going off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now with the basics covered let's get into the nitty gritty! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Core Passive - Nitro-Fuel Cocktail is the source of her most important mechanics - “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status and Afterburn damage off-field. Let’s start with “Heat” first Burnice starts the battle with and can hold up to 100 “Heat” at a time. She gains 1.4 “Heat” per 1 energy spent and upon reaching 50 “Heat” enters the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State which she will maintain until her “Heat” reaches 0. After which she’ll need to reach 50 again to re-enter.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State she gains access to a new Enhanced Basic Attack and is able to apply the “Scorch” status when hitting enemies with any of the following abilities: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend (Nitro-Fuel Cocktail Enhanced Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Any EX-Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned earlier, whenever a Scorched enemy takes damage from a squad member other than Burnice, they suffer Afterburn taking up to 350% of Burnice’s ATK as Assist Attack","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"type damage immediately and a good chunk of Fire Anomaly buildup at the cost of 8 “Heat” per activation. Afterburn can only trigger once every 1.5 seconds and as soon as the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state ends at 0 “Heat” all scorches will be removed immediately. As an added bonus for every 10 Anomaly Proficiency Burnice has, her Afterburn damage is boosted by 1% up to 30% (Requires 300 Anomaly Proficiency). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s standard Basic Attack is a multi-part combo consisting of 5 attacks with Physical and Fire hits mixed in. None of these hits deal much damage or interact with “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status, or Afterburn so aren’t usually used. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bar this she gains access to the Special Charged Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend when in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State. Upon pressing and holding the Basic Attack button, she immediately consumes up to 20 “Heat” to perform a channeled spinning attack that applies “Scorch”, good Fire Anomaly, and deals reasonable damage. This ability is ideal for quick application of “Scorch” without any conditions or consumption of energy when you have maximum “Heat”, additionally while this ability consumes up to 20 “Heat” it is still useable with even 1 “Heat” as long as you’re still within the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Dash Attack and Dodge Counter, similar to her standard Basic Attacks, have no bearing on her “Heat” or “Scorch” mechanics so they aren’t used outside of niche scenarios where you need to avoid damage or close a gap.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Also in a similar vein is her Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up. These attacks do reasonable damage and apply strong Anomaly for their field-time requirements but aren’t critical for her gameplay. As such if the opportunity to use them arises they’re worthwhile but not mandatory in any case.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her Ultimate hits incredibly hard, deals a tremendous amount of Anomaly, and takes up very little field time for how effective it is","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - all thanks to the fact that halfway through casting it she triggers a Quick Assist for her teammates and can switch out while she continues casting it off-field. On top of all this, her Ultimate generates her 50 “Heat” allowing her to keep her Afterburn trigger continuously without being solely reliant on her energy if timed correctly. Her Chain attack is also worth using when available as long as no other team member requires their Chain Attack to function - it deals a decent chunk of damage, large amounts of Fire Anomaly build-up, and is relatively quick to use. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Finally let's talk about her Special and EX-Special attacks. As with most characters, Burnice’s standard Special Attack isn’t used. Although when it comes to her EX she has two of them - “Standard Shot” and “Double Shot” - both of them are channeled Flamethrower attacks that deal continuous damage, massive Fire Anomaly, consume energy over a short duration and deal an explosion at the end. The difference between the two is as follows:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" “Standard Shot” consumes a relatively small amount of energy over its duration, makes use of only one of her Flamethrowers, and allows her to reposition mid-channel by strafing left or right. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Double Shot” on the other hand consumes significantly more energy (over 2x), uses both of her Flamethrowers, deals more Anomaly and damage, lacks repositioning, and has an activation requirement.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In most cases, it’s advisable to use “Double Shot” as it has a similar channel time to “Single Shot” but does significantly more damage and Anomaly application while also converting her energy into “Heat” at a faster pace. In order to access “Double Shot” when using the EX-Special instead of the standard “Single Shot” simply tap the EX twice in quick succession (which will cause it to swap from “Single” to “Double” after a short delay) or make use of the EX immediately after any of the following abilities to skip out on having to double tap the ability (Executes with no delay);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack: Fuel-Fed Flame","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Scorching Dew","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a final bonus, her Additional Ability grants her 65% additional Fire Anomaly Buildup to the following abilities;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Both EX Special Attacks “Single” and “Double”","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Afterburn","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"On top of this, it also extends all Burns inflicted by the squad by 3 seconds. It goes without saying this Additional Ability is worth activating and should always be a goal to consider when building a team for Burnice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now let’s bring it all together - when playing Burnice all you need to worry about is to keep your enemy consistently Scorched and maintain a healthy amount of “Heat” via timely Ultimate and EX-Special “Double Shot” use. Outside of this other abilities can be optionally used but focusing on granting your allies as much field time as possible while her Afterburn constantly triggers is generally her best play. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"As it should be clear by now that without “Heat”, she can’t make use of a very large part of her kit and to maintain it she either needs a steady supply of energy for EX’s or the use of her Ultimate. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As such she is definitely one of the more energy-hungry characters - more so in long drawn-out fights. To remedy this somewhat ensure no “Heat” is wasted when using EX-Specials or Ultimates.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice serves as a top-tier Anomaly Sub-DPS option","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" especially when paired with characters who can make use of the field-time she frees up. If you’re looking to further invest into Anomaly, specifically Disorder, she's a great addition to any endgame roster. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a Sub-DPS who doesn't need to steal the field time from other characters, she can be easily slotted into various teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible Fire Anomaly Application - ideal for Burn or Disorder-focused teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can deal a significant portion of her damage and Anomaly application while off-field doubling down on her low field-time playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has surprisingly high direct damage multipliers for an Anomaly character giving her the option to gain extra damage through stats such as Critical Rate and Critical Damage if you find it on gear.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy To Play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
