build.substats: CRIT RATE > CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Beat of the Hammer
talents.desc: After the 2nd or 4th hit of Koleda's Basic Attack or her enhanced Basic Attack, quickly use a Special Attack or EX Special Attack to increase the Daze dealt by 15%.

talents.name: Kinetic Recovery
talents.desc: When Koleda's EX Special Attack hits an enemy, she recovers 60 Energy. Can trigger once every 45s.

talents.name: Don’t Mess With Me!
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Furnace’s Glow
talents.desc: Koleda gains one stack of Charge (max 2 stacks) when consuming Furnace Fire to use her Enhanced Basic Attack. When her Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, she consumes all stacks of Charge to increase the attack's DMG by 18% per stack.

talents.name: You Dare Underestimate Me?
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Saturated Blast
talents.desc: When EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate triggers an explosion that hits an enemy, it deals additional DMG equal to 360% of Koleda's ATK.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Small & Cute, With Some Fierce Combat Power. She may be small, but can certainly wield that huge hammer. A Fierce Young Girl Who's Also a President. The young leader at the helm of Belobog Industries. A President Who Leads by Example. She prefers to work out in the field, rather than being stuck at a desk. Leads by Example While Maintaining Her Cute Nature.\nHer maturity sometimes gives way to occasional childishness. She's a leader who sometimes needs to be taken care of by her followers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter is an S-Rank Melee Fire Stun Agent fulfilling the role of a low field time Daze character who also brings incredible supportive buffs for Ice and Fire teammates.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Stun characters continue following a trend of picking up absurd supportive abilities and Lighter only takes this to the next level by sporting buffs that rival (and even exceed) many dedicated Support Agents - all the while fulfilling his role as a Stunner. Furthermore, he is the first Agent in the game capable of manipulating the duration enemies are Stunned for, allowing him to extend burst windows and doubling down on his supportive identity. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"It wouldn’t be entirely inaccurate to call Lighter a Stun and Support Hybrid, but his Daze output is top class thus pushing him more in that direction, to learn more let's dive in.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lighter’s kit is wordy and confusing… but his playstyle is anything but that. In combat he has one mission: wait in the wings allowing his teammates to fight until his unique resource bar “Morale” is between 80-100% filled, swap in, execute a flurry of devastating attacks consuming said “Morale” and swap out. This combo takes minimal time, applies all of his buffs, debuffs and delivers a strong amount of Daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter’s Core Passive: Accelerant","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" is at the heart of his kit and is mandatory for his combo - as without it he would be dead in the water. Accelent allows him to gain up to 100 of his resource gauge “Morale” from two different sources. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first being his Passive, which allows him to gain 2.9 “Morale” every second regardless of the fact if he is on the field or not. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second source is reliant on your squad - for every 1 Energy your squadmates spend (Including Lighter himself) he’ll generate 0.26 “Morale”. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For example, you’ll gain 15.6 “Morale” when an ally or Lighter spends 60 Energy on their EX Special.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Morale” isn’t usable until Lighter gains at least 80 of it, after which he gains access to a myriad of bonuses. The first of which is the ability to trigger a Quick Assist for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"one time","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" the next time he switches in ignoring the usual rules of the Assist.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second is the ability to enter the “Morale Burst State” upon executing the 5th portion of his Basic Attack. While in the “Morale Burst State” he cannot generate “Morale” through his Passive or from Energy consumption.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the “Morale Burst State” Lighter gains the following effects:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lighter’s 5th Basic Attack is enhanced causing it to consume “Morale” rapidly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For every 10 “Morale” consumed by Lighter, it grants him 2% Combat Impact for 6 seconds up to a maximum of 20%.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Any attack landed during the state applies a 15% ICE & FIRE RES Shred for 30 seconds.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Causes the final portion of his Basic Attack 5 to apply “Collapse” to any target hit. “Collapse” causes the next Stun the enemy suffers to be extended by an additional 3 seconds, “Collapse” cannot stack and is removed after the enemy recovers from Stun. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After entering the “Morale Burst State” it’s heavily recommended you fully consume all of Lighter’s “Morale” swiftly and immediately to ensure you land the biggest Combat Impact buff possible, fully stack his buffs/debuffs and ensure you’re back to generating “Morale” as soon as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter’s Additional Ability: Fighting Spirit","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" is for the most part an extension of his Core Ability and absurdly powerful, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"so ensure that you","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" build teams in order to activate it. Now what it does is that while within the “Morale Burst State” each of the hits caused by his 5th empowered Basic Attack grants all squad members a stack of “Elation” for a maximum of 20 stacks lasting for 30 seconds. While the 20 Stacks might sound like a lot, Lighter’s empowered 5th Basic Attack can hit many more times than that - so you’ll have no issues maxing this out when playing correctly. The “Elation” Buff grants those affected by it up to 75% FIRE and ICE DMG%. Each stack of “Elation” grants 1.25% FIRE and ICE DMG% or 25%... hold on then, what about the other 50%? For every 10 points of Impact Lighter possesses over 170, each “Elation” stack grants an additional 0.25% bonus for. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Thus at 270 Impact we’ll gain 3.75% DMG increase per stack instead, allowing him to reach the maximum bonus of 75%. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The 30-second duration of this buff is huge in itself but as an added bonus whenever an ally performs a Chain Attack, its duration will be refreshed making its uptime pretty much permanent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Phew… believe it or not that makes up for the majority of Lighter’s kit and as we’ve now learnt his whole kit essentially boils down to gaining access to 80 “Morale”, entering the “Morale Burst State” and executing an Empowered Basic Attack 5. Doing this applies all of his buffs and debuffs. With the wordy part covered lets breeze through the rest of his mostly simple kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter has a TON of different Basic Attacks - all of which might have their place in certain niche and specialized combat scenarios… but, when it comes to his core gameplay you use barely any of them. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His standard Basic Attack combo consists of 5 attacks - the first 3 are Physical and the last 2 are Fire. We want to avoid using the first 3 wherever possible, as they have poor multipliers across the board. Fortunately many of his abilities allow him to skip straight to executing either the 4th or 5th portion of the Basic Attack string - as such these are the abilities to watch out for:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Blazing Flash (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut (Skips to 4th Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Dash Variant (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist: Blazing Flash - Guard (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Reignition (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With proper planning, you’ll find yourself able to completely omit the first 3 - 4 Basic Attacks of the combo and skip straight to what matters the most - Basic Attack 5. Basic Attack 5 is further split up into 3 different parts and can only be fully accessed by Continuously Tapping or Holding the Basic Attack button throughout his 5 Basic Attack combo or after any of the follow-ups above. The three different parts of Basic Attack 5 are:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“StartUp”:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“StartUp” is a flurry of punches that follows right up after executing his Basic Attack 4 but ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"will not be present if you skipped directly to Basic Attack 5 via another ability. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Combo”:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"“","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Combo” is a continual flurry of punches that hits many many times in quick succession (And this is how we reach 20 stacks of “Elation”). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Finisher”:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Finisher” is exactly how it sounds: a huge haymaker to finish the combo off. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the “Morale Burst State” each of these abilities consumes “Morale” and is, enhanced dealing more Damage and Daze whie also gaining additional effects. When enhanced “Combo” can be repeated as long as you possess “Morale” to consume, doing so will allow you to extend your flurry of punches to stack “Elation”, it’s always a good idea to channel “Combo” until 0 “Morale” because of the next enhancement. When running out of “Morale” while executing the 5th Basic attack within “Morale Burst State” Lighter’s “Finisher” is supercharged into “Powerful Finisher” dealing further increased Daze and Damage. Another bonus of running your “Morale” to 0 with “Combo” is that it ensures “Powerful Finisher” will have the maximum Combat Impact % buff from his Core Passive.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"An additional note is that Lighter’s Basic attack combo can be fully chained and executed simply by holding down the Basic Attack button. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Also as mentioned earlier his Basic Attacks do have more to them but with his current top playstyle they’re not worth delving into. With “Morale” up, get to Basic Attack 5 as fast as possible, dump all “Morale” into repeating the “Combo” portion and land a huge “Powerful Finisher”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lighter’s EX-Special Attack costs 40 Energy, deals good Daze, damage, and of course helps him recover some “Morale” while also skipping straight to Basic Attack 4. What makes it stand out though is that Lighter can tap EX-Special again right after its use to execute a Follow-Up Attack at the cost of an additional 20 Energy. This is usually well worth it as the attack doesn’t take much longer to execute and deals good Daze for its Energy cost. Lighter’s EX-Special also has an alternative mode which can be accessed by hitting the EX-Special key right after a Dash - something that isn’t easy to do consistently without some practice. As mentioned above the Dash-EX allows you to skip to Basic Attack 5 instead of 4.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter’s Chain Attack and Ultimate are completely standard - even a bit boring you might say.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" His Ultimate doesn’t do anything special while his Chain Attack can be used if there is a slot available, it is a low priority compared to those who need it more.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As with most Stun characters, Lighter’s Dodge Counter is actually surprisingly strong having good multipliers and allowing him to immediately skip straight to Basic Attack 5 - use it when the opportunity presents itself.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter’s assists like his Dodge Counter are strong and absolutely worth using. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The combo of his Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up should be the go-to for you when playing him, as he prefers to stay off-field most of the time. Remain on-field with your other two characters but Hot-Swap to Lighter to execute his Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up while you wait for his “Morale” to recover for his next combo. It’s worth noting when you finally do reach 80-100 “Morale” entering combat via a Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up is the optimal way to maximize Daze output. Lighter’s Quick assist is also very useful, you’ll gain free access to it every time you reach 80 “Morale” in the resource bar. If you reach 80-100 “Morale” and you don’t see an opening to Swap-In Lighter optimally, following the above this is your go to for a quick skip to the 5th Basic Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With Lighter’s kit fully covered let's bring all of it together. Here’s the final game plan:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Wait until Lighter reaches 80 - 100 “Morale” (100 will maximize his Core Passive bonuses and is recommended in most cases).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Swap to Lighter Via a Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up OR a Quick Assist.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hold down the Basic Attack to execute Basic Attack 5 “Combo” to fully drain your “Morale” and trigger his “Powerful Finisher”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"If Energy is available add in either an EX Special or EX Special + Follow-Up.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Here it is listed in abilities:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Defensive Assist: Swift Break","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Charging Slam - Stab","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Basic Attack: L-Form Thundering Fist (5th-Hit Combo)(Morale Boosted)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Basic Attack: L-Form Thundering Fist (5th-Hit Powerful Finisher)(Morale Boosted)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Full Distance                ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Full Distance (Follow-Up)   ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"And that’s really it. The above will grant you all of Lighter’s buffs, debuffs, and do a large amount of Daze. If you’re looking for more though here are some additional things you can watch out for.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In the rare case Lighter is on the field execute Dodge Counters for more Daze Build-Up","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ensure you never overcap on Energy - swap Lighter in to execute EX-Special’s even outside his usual combo if you’re about to overcap.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Perform Defensive Assists + Assist Follow-Ups whenever possible for additional Daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Optionally execute Non-Morale sequences of Basic Attack 4 + 5 to take advantage of the skips granted by your other abilities (The Daze output from these isn’t stellar but can fill empty field time or get you the last bit of the way to a stun)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In combat scenarios that don’t demand Lighter’s full burst combo (Non-elite enemies) tactically use his EX, Defensive Assist, or Dodge counter to trigger Stuns as needed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lighter is an incredible Stun character fully capable of serving as a support and at the same time, he has crazy buffs/debuffs, huge burst Daze, extended Stuns and is simple to play.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" He has a few downsides but nothing deal-breaking. Reaching 270 Impact to fully activate his 75% bonus via his Additional Ability isn’t trivial though, and you'll need Impact-focused W-engines to make it happen - which depending on your account might pose a challenge. And of course, Lighter is a Fire and Ice specialist so if those elements aren’t for you, he loses a lot of his value. If those aren’t a problem though, Lighter is definitely a force to be reckoned with.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible full team ICE and FIRE DMG% Boost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants substantial ICE and FIRE RES% Shred.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Extends enemy Stun duration by 3 seconds, allowing for larger burst windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has an incredibly front-loaded combo capable of taking up minimal field time if desired.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Simple and easy to play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Daze application is much more concentrated than other characters, sometimes leading to downtime when Morale, Energy and Counter opportunities aren’t available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Primarily synergizes with Fire and Ice units only, limiting the scope of his potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Loses supportive capabilities when unable to hit 270 Impact - something that isn’t easy to achieve without using 5-star W-Engines.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE > CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: The Champion
talents.desc: Among the debuffs imposed by Core Passive: Accelerant, the Collapse effect increases Stun duration by 5s, while further reducing Ice RES and Fire RES by 10%. The more powerful Finishing Move that follows when Lighter's Morale is completely exhausted during a startup light punch or jab combo deals 30% increased DMG.

talents.name: Red Scarf
talents.desc: When applying Collapse by Core Passive: Accelerant to enemies, the target's Stun DMG Multiplier increases by 25%. The increase to Ice DMG and Fire DMG provided by Elation from Additional Ability: Fighting Spirit increases to 120% of the original.

talents.name: Mercenary Leader
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Sunglasses
talents.desc: When Lighter is off-field, the Energy Regen for the on-field character is increased by 10%. Upon entering the Morale Burst state, Lighter restores 4 Energy for off-field characters. This effect can trigger once every 18s.

talents.name: Decision Maker
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Inhuman Blood
talents.desc: Lighter's Morale recovery efficiency is increased to 200% of its original value. When Lighter lands a heavy strike on enemies during a Basic Attack, Dodge Counter, Special Attack, EX Special Attack, Quick Assist, Assist Follow-Up, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, it will trigger the Blazing Impact effect, dealing 250% of ATK as Fire DMG. This effect can trigger once every 8s on each enemy. If Lighter's Impact exceeds 170 points, each additional point will further increase the multiplier of Blazing Impact by 5%, up to a maximum increase of 500%. The more powerful Finishing Move that follows when Lighter's Morale is completely exhausted during a light punch or jab combo will trigger an additional activation of Blazing Impact when hitting an enemy, ignoring the effect's cooldown.

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lucy is an A-rank Fire Support Agent whose primary role is to get in, summon her Guard Boars, buff your entire team’s ATK and get out","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". Just like that, we’ve summed up her gameplay in a single sentence. Jokes aside, even if that’s functionally what she does, let’s get into the specifics. We’ll even throw in some additional techniques you can use with her to optimize your team’s damage as much as you can.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lucy’s primary mechanic lies in the “Cheer On!” buff that is detailed in her Special Attack. Thanks to her Mindscape 2, using her EX Special isn’t the only way to acquire this buff, however it remains the primary method.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Via using her EX Special (along with her Chain Attack and Ultimate at Mindscape 2 and above), Lucy grants the Cheer On! buff which gives all allies a portion of her ATK, up to a maximum of 600 flat ATK points.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" This buff constitutes Lucy’s primary utility, however her M2 and particularly her M6 should allow for really easy permanent uptime on this buff. There are two versions of her EX Special: a slower charged version with a longer buff duration accessible by holding EX Special, and a faster tap version with a shorter buff duration and slightly lower damage than the charged version. However, this goes mostly unused. It’s possible to use the charged version right after using an Ultimate since there’s a small time window after Lucy’s Ultimate during which you need to wait before switching out via a Quick Assist, but after acquiring Lucy’s M2 this becomes redundant. Overall, the tap version is preferred in almost every scenario.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Speaking of Lucy’s Ultimate, it constitutes a quick and easy way to deal damage, apply the Cheer On! buff at M2 and apply some Fire anomaly (deals decent damage thanks to Lucy wanting to build lots of ATK to maximize the Cheer On! buff).","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Also, both her Ultimate and EX Specials are very simple ways to generate lots of Quick Assists. Similarly to Nicole, this is an easy way to ensure uptime on sets like Astral Voice, and benefits characters with added value to their Quick Assists.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Chain is the most unique part of her kit since it functions differently to other characters.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" With very precise timing and enough distance separating Lucy from the enemy target, Lucy is able to switch out to another Agent in the middle of her Chain animation. This has a really interesting effect. Normally, it is impossible to Chain twice into the same Agent. However, it’s possible to do so with what’s called a Chain cancel. By cancelling your next Chain Attack after Chaining into a given Agent, you can switch out of that Agent, trigger a Chain window again, and Chain into that same Agent once more, allowing you to Chain twice with the same Agent. This is useful for two reasons: Chains give a lot of Decibels so you can grant more Ultimates to your Main DPS Agent. Chains also benefit some characters more than others and deal high damage, which generally leads to improvements if your Main DPS character is doing them twice.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Note that this technique is only executable on Boss enemies since they are the only kind of target that allows for 3 total Chain Attacks per Stun (remember that you are cancelling one of them and are left over with two).","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This usually comes at the cost of not being able to do a Chain Attack with any other Agent since you cancelled one Chain, however thanks to Lucy’s unique Chain Attack properties, it gives you the peculiar effect of being able to switch into your third Agent and do a Chain with Lucy while still doing 2 Chains with the same Agent. So you get the benefits of Chain Cancelling without the losses. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This is really good to execute because it funnels extra Decibels for your entire party for even higher Ultimate frequency, and adds that little bit of extra damage with Lucy’s Chain Attack on top of refreshing Cheer On! right before a stun window with Lucy’s M2.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"How it looks like should be like this: let’s assume you are running a Sons of Calydon team with Piper, Burnice and Lucy. Burnice or Lucy trigger a Chain Attack, and you’re trying to Double Chain into Piper. You Chain into Piper once, then Chain into Lucy and switch out by mashing the switch button right before the Chain Attack lands on the enemy. You end up on Burnice and trigger a Chain Attack with her once again. You’re able to chain into Piper a second time for a Piper - Lucy - Piper Chain sequence, which is normally impossible, but Lucy’s unique Chain Attack allows for that!","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Once again, friendly reminder that this is ONLY possible with Lucy on the team and against a Boss enemy provided enough distance","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". This is really specific, however you’ll find it’s more applicable than you think in places like Deadly Assault. Definitely worth it to experiment with this!","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As Lucy’s gameplay is really simple, there really isn’t much to go into detail about beyond what’s already been explained. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Just use your EX Special, Ultimate or Chain to ensure maximum uptime of the Cheer On! buff. Other than that, Lucy should never come on field and instead let your DPS Agents take the spotlight for the highest damage potential possible. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Meta-wise, thanks to Lucy buffing ATK which is the most universal stat to provide, and being able to do so especially quickly with utmost ease, she is one of the most widely applicable Support Agents you can invest into. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"While she falls short of more specialized peers, her general use is nothing to be scoffed at, and she has particular synergies with the rest of the Sons of Calydon as she’s able to effortlessly activate their Additional Abilities, if you’re missing a Support Agent to buff your team. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In conclusion, Lucy is an easy, plug-and-play, widely applicable Support Agent who has some of the highest versatility and ease of use in the game. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"While more specialized Agents may outdo her, she always comes close to them in value. Overall, it’s never a bad decision to invest into Lucy since she can realistically be used anywhere, with anyone, as her Additional Ability is barely necessary (Guard Boar damage being really subpar and ignorable). She scales well with Mindscapes, but even at M0 she will deliver exactly how you expect her to!","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Does off-field damage and Daze thanks to her Guard Boars — decent personal damage overall by pure Support standards;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the whole squad (along with Bangboos and Guard Boars) a 600 flat ATK buff which is really easy to maintain;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Super easy to play, takes minimal field time and only needs to execute 1 ability to access all of her buffs;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The embodiment of a generalist character, usable everywhere, with everyone, to an acceptable extent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK buff is really good with easy maintenance, but falls short of other options that are more technical like Nicole or simply harder to acquire like Astra Yao;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guard Boars sometimes just won’t attack an enemy who’s too fast for them to keep up — Lucy’s age in spite of her small stature seems to affect even her pets…","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: ATK% (top priority until ability cap) = CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG  > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Drill Formations
talents.desc: When the guard boars launch Guard Boars: Spinning Swing!, Lucy recovers 2 Energy. This effect can trigger once every 15s, with each guard boar having its own separate cooldown.

talents.name: Little Boar Captain
talents.desc: When Lucy uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, it grants all squad members, Bangboo, and the guard boars the Cheer On! status for 10s.

talents.name: Ironfist Overseer
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chaos Ball Game
talents.desc: While in the Cheer On! state, allies' CRIT DMG is increased by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Wildland Princess
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Fierce Fangs of Fire
talents.desc: When an ally in the Cheer On! state hits an enemy with an EX Special Attack, a guard boar will drop from the sky and cause an explosion, dealing Fire DMG equal to 300% of the guard boar's ATK. This will extend the duration of the Cheer On! buff for all squad members by 5s. The duration can increase up to 3 times, with a maximum duration of 30s. Refreshing the Cheer On! state resets the stack count. After the guard boar's explosion, it will launch Guard Boars: Spinning Swing!.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"An honored guest just arrived. Allow me, Lady Lucy, to entertain you!\" Luciana Auxesis Theodoro de Montefio ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability amplifies the standard Stun multiplier from 150% to 185% increasing team burst damage during the Stun window tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core ability applies 25% Ice Res Shred for 30 seconds allowing for near infinite uptime on enemies boosting the damage of Ice characters by an incredible amount.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals massive amounts of Daze unconditionally with his charged basic attack combo allowing him to act as a main field Dazer delivering absurd Daze on the field while still having the option to support a Main DPS with Parries and EX’s when they are available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Limited usage out of Ice teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Full Moon Momentum
talents.desc: When Lycaon's EX Special Attack hits an enemy, the attack's Daze increases by 12%. This effect can trigger once every 8s. When he charges his EX Special Attack to completion, this buff will increase by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Energy Feedback
talents.desc: When Stunning an enemy or triggering a squad member's Chain Attack, Lycaon gains 5 Energy. Can trigger once every 1s.

talents.name: Attendant Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Graceful Demeanor
talents.desc: If Lycaon is attacked while using a Basic Attack or Special Attack, he will immediately gain a Shield effect equal to 7.5% of his max HP, lasting for 15s. During the Shield's duration, his Anti-Interrupt level is increased. This effect can trigger once every 15s.

talents.name: Alpha Nature
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ruthless Hunter
talents.desc: When a charged attack hits an enemy, the target suffers 10% increased DMG from Lycaon, stacking up to 5 times and lasting 12s. Only one stack can be gained per skill use, and repeated triggers reset the duration.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can resolve any matter. The most trusted of attendants, and solid support for any team. Rational and wise, a true gentleman who can't tolerate a single stain. Offers absolute loyalty to the one he decides to follow. Though outwardly sophisticated and rational, his innate feral character will reveal itself when faced with certain dangers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Miyabi is an S-Rank Melee Frost Anomaly Agent and is the first (and perhaps the last) Frost character ZZZ will see.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" In addition to bringing a new element to the game, she is also the first Anomaly unit that specifically only wants a CRIT-based build. Yeah. Miyabi really is the odd character that breaks all the rules. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now, what does she bring to the table? ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The answer is a simple one - an absurd amount of damage","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", more than any other character released so far to the point of setting a new bar for what to expect in the future. Similar to Yanagi and Jane, Miyabi continues the trend of Anomaly characters dealing huge burst damage up front, making her just as effective at immediate damage as any DPS character currently released. To understand how to get the most out of the powerhouse that is Miyabi let’s dive into her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"While in combat, her game plan is simple: she wants to execute her most powerful attack - Basic Attack: Shimotsuki at the right time, being fully charged and as frequently as possible","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Shimotsuki is an enhanced version of her Basic Attack accessible by pressing and holding the button to charge. It can be charged up to 3 times based on her resources on hand and upon reaching max charges, it deals as much damage as most other characters' Ultimates. As such, the entirety of Miyabi’s kit and rotation will revolve around generating resources for fully charged Shimotsuki and timing them just right. So let's learn exactly how to do that.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her unique resource is a special gauge consisting of 6 Orbs called “Fallen Frost”.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" “Fallen Frost” is how you access and charge her enhanced Basic Attack Shimotsuki, as such accumulating “Fallen Frost” is always of the utmost importance. Miyabi can generate “Fallen Frost” in the following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"3 Orbs upon entering the battle for the first time (only happens once).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"3 Orbs upon releasing her Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Orbs upon using either of her EX Special attacks (4 when both are used together).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Orbs when any squad member triggers Disorder.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"1 Orb upon triggering Frostburn - Break via Frost Anomaly (10-second cooldown).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As you can see, that’s a lot of ways to gain Orbs but Miyabi needs all 6 filled before she can unleash her most powerful attack - something you’ll want to be saving for each time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Basic Attacks are how we’ll be not only spending “Fallen Frost” but also filling some downtime. Her Basic Attacks are split into two different abilities. The first is a standard 5 part combo consisting of 2 Physical attacks initially and 3 Frost attacks at the end. The second is her charged Basic Attack: Shimotsuki which can only be accessed when you have at least 2 Orbs of “Fallen Frost”. Each charge of Shimotsuki requires 2 additional Orbs of “Fallen Frost” to access, with the most powerful version requiring 6 Orbs (3 Charges). Outside of Shimotsuki, her rotations also make use of her standard Basic Attack combo albeit with some skips accessed via ability sequencing. The most common of these skips is being able to bypass using the first 2 Physical attacks of the combo by using an EX Special Attack immediately followed by Basic Attacks allowing for the following combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This skip is important as we want to use her Frost Basic Attacks specifically in order to fully build up Frost Anomaly to gain the Orb of “Fallen Frost” that comes along with it. To sum it up - use her charged Basic Attack when you have 6 Orbs and use ability skips to access parts 3, 4, and 5 of her standard Basic Attack combo to build any additional Anomaly you need.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Speaking of Anomaly, it's time to talk about Frost. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Frost works like every other Anomaly when it comes to buildup - that is, use abilities of the Frost type and you’ll gain Frost buildup. Frost has a lot of similarities with the Ice Anomaly. Fully filling the Frost gauge will apply Freeze, Frostbite, and upon Freeze ending a Shatter. Where it differs from Ice is that it has a higher Anomaly multiplier and most importantly of all ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"is not Ice","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" meaning its build-up and Anomaly are separate allowing you to trigger Disorders between Ice and Frost Anomalies (very handy when playing Miyabi with other Ice Agents).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"As an Anomaly unit Miyabi needs some way to boost her Anomaly damage and that's where her Core Passive comes in. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whenever Miyabi hits an enemy with any Frost damage she applies Icefire to them increasing her Frost Anomaly buildup against them by 100% of her CRIT RATE up to a maximum of 80% (80% CRIT Rate = 80% Frost Anomaly Buildup Rate). Also when Miyabi triggers her Frost Anomaly she’ll consume all Icefire on the target to inflict a Frostburn - Break, dealing a large amount of damage which can be a Critical hit, generating an Orb of “Fallen Frost” and placing them in the Frostburn state. While in the Frostburn state, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"the target suffers 20% more Anomaly buildup from all your squad members at the cost of Miyabi being unable to apply Icefire during this time","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Frostburn lasts as long as the enemy is afflicted with Frostbite, which can be removed by triggering a Disorder - something Miyabi just so happens to want to happen thanks to it granting 2 Orbs of Fallen Frost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"So it basically boils down to: aim for 80% CRIT RATE to get the maximum bonus, trigger Frost Anomaly as fast as you can for the orb of “Fallen Frost” and bonus damage from Frostburn - Break, and use another character to leverage Frostburn to trigger disorder for even more “Fallen Frost” Orbs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi has two EX Specials both of which are standard Frost attacks with the exception being that they generate 2 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” each. Both attacks consume 40 Energy with the second only being usable immediately following the first. If you need a full 4 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” up front using both the initial and follow-up EX is effective, but if you only need two or want to leverage the ability to skip Basic Attacks using only the first EX is also a valid choice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Ultimate delivers massive Frost damage, grants her a 30% Ice DMG boost for 12 seconds (Applies to Frost Attacks), and generates 3 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” - you should aim to use this during the Stun window. Her Chain attack is even simpler; it just deals huge AoE Frost damage but unfortunately, no “Fallen Frost” Orbs are generated here.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Similar to her Chain Attack, Miyabi’s Dash Attacks, Dodge Counter, and Assists are simple and as standard as they come with no special effects or bonuses - use them as needed like you would on other agents. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rounding out her kit is Miyabi’s Additional ability and it’s a big one. While active her Basic Attack: Shimotsuki gains a 60% DMG increase, ignores 30% Ice RES (works for Frost as well) and whenever any squad mate triggers Disorder she gains 2 “Fallen Frost” Orbs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now it’s time to bring it all together and cover how to combine these abilities alongside some optimizations you can make to take Miyabi’s damage to the next level.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Fight Opener","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When opening a fight we know Miyabi starts with 3 Orbs of “Fallen Frost”, we can use this to our advantage. Executing a single EX Special alongside the follow-up combo of 3 Basic Attacks can be enough to trigger the Frost Anomaly on many enemies allowing for an immediate activation of a fully charged Shimotsuki to kick the fight off.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (5 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5 (Triggers Frost Anomaly 6 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Against enemies with higher Anomaly gauges this doesn’t work; you can add extra attacks to achieve a similar opening effect.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Standard Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Without the assistance of her starting 3 Orbs, Miyabi instead has to rely on her energy and EX’s or her teammates and Disorder triggers in order to gain Fallen Frost. Here are a few examples of how that plays out.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Example 1:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ally Applies Anomaly to Enemy","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (2 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P2 (4 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5 (Triggers Frost Anomaly & Disorder 6 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Example 2:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ally Applies Triggers Disorder & Applies Anomaly to Enemy (2 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (4 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5 (Triggers Frost Anomaly & Disorder 6 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In both examples Miyabi can easily access her fully charged Shimotsuki but bouncing back and forth between applying her Frost Anomaly and then consuming it with another team member to trigger Disorder allows for much greater energy efficiency.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Ultimate Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Ultimate should ideally always be used when the enemy is Stunned but thanks to the 3 “Fallen Frost” charges it grants it mixes up the possibilities a little bit. Like with the combos above, including a Disorder trigger or at the very least an Anomaly application from an ally is ideal. Here is what to shoot for:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate (Triggers Frost Anomaly & Disorder 2 + 3 + 1 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many more combos are possible than just these with Miyabi and the examples above are only just that - examples. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"One other thing to note when playing her is the possibility of Quick Swap.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" The animation time on Basic Attack: Shimotsuki is painfully slow and if you swap the character after fully charging it, Miyabi will in fact fully execute the attack even while you’re playing another character. Because of this performing a “Quick-Swap” after fully charging can save you a lot of time and boost her DPS massively (recommended for those looking to maximize performance).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To conclude Miyabi absolutely takes the word damage to a new level in ZZZ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - she’s incredibly fun to play, has a heap of flavor with her charged attacks & Frost element, and has a lot of teams she’s viable in. If you’re after power she’s a good choice, if you’re a fan of her design you can rest easy as she’s a top performer at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Absurdly large damage multipliers giving \"hit like a truck\" a new meaning,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Huge AoE on many attacks, allowing her to quickly deal with big groups of monsters,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A good amount of team options for both spenders and F2P,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She sets a new bar for how strong a DPS can be in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As one of the first CRIT Anomaly characters her W-Engine options outside her signature are limited,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies on applying Frost Anomaly at specific points in her combo for maximum effectiveness - disruption to this can cause issues,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Really wants to achieve 80% CRIT RATE for the 80% Anomaly Buildup to assist with the point above, making her stat-hungry,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rotations and playstyle can drastically change based on team composition leading to a steep path to mastery,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has many long animations which you'll want to Quick Swap to another squad member to alleviate. This introduces a new axis of skill for those looking for the best results.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE (Until 80%) >= CRIT DMG = ATK% > Anomaly Proficiency = ATK = PEN

talents.name: Frost Atop the Snow
talents.desc: While in Shimotsuki Stance, every 1 point of Fallen Frost consumed will allow Basic Attack: Shimotsuki to ignore 6% of DEF, stacking up to 6 times and lasting until Shimotsuki Stance ends. When the slash for charge level three of Basic Attack: Shimotsuki hits an enemy under Frostburn, it will immediately remove the Frostburn state and increase all squad members' Anomaly Buildup Rate by 20% for 10s.

talents.name: Breath Technique
talents.desc: Basic Attack: Kazahana and Dodge Counter DMG increases by 30%. Hoshimi Miyabi gains 1 point of Fallen Frost when the final move of the 5th hit of Basic Attack: Kazahana hits an enemy. Upon entering the battlefield, Hoshimi Miyabi immediately obtains 6 points of Fallen Frost and her CRIT Rate increases by 15%.

talents.name: Martial Discipline
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Rupture
talents.desc: Frostburn - Break DMG increases by 30%. Upon triggering Frostburn - Break, Hoshimi Miyabi generates 250 more Decibels.

talents.name: Anniversary
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Prodigious Talent
talents.desc: During Shimotsuki Stance, Hoshimi Miyabi obtains Polar, which increases Basic Attack: Shimotsuki DMG by 30%. After obtaining Polar, Hoshimi Miyabi will automatically draw her blade and unleash powerful slashes based on the current charge level upon consuming Fallen Frost. Before Fallen Frost is completely depleted, the draw and slashes will not interrupt charging under Shimotsuki Stance. Each occurrence of Shimotsuki Stance can perform up to 3 draws and slashes.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The head of Hollow Special Operations Section 6, and the successor of a renowned martial art family in New Eridu. With her strong sense of responsibility towards guarding the principles and order within New Eridu, Miyabi aspires to build an unbreakable city management system... and to own a sizable collection of swords (her own words).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has great AoE coverage on her Ultimate, Chain, and Dodge Counter allowing for easy cleanup of weaker enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple team synergies among free-to-play characters even if they aren’t as strong as other characters' best teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible mobility with a Dash Attack that is a borderline teleport.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fast attacking and dodge-based kit perfect for those who enjoy a fast-paced playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly cheap EX Special meaning it will be available far more frequently than other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires constant use of Dodge Counters or Quick Assists in order to keep her Core passive ability active whereas many other characters get theirs permanently active for free.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"During Stun damage windows when the enemy cannot attack, Nekomata must rely on her Support to grant her a Quick Assist or go without a large damage bonus.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has big competition among her element (Physical).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has incredibly limited team synergy options.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2500-3100+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"9500+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"70% - 80%+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"140% - 160%+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Bird Hunter
talents.desc: When Nekomata hits an enemy from behind, she ignores 16% of the target's Physical RES. If the enemy is Stunned, all Nekomata's attacks are considered back attacks.

talents.name: Cat & Mouse
talents.desc: When there's only one enemy on the field and Nekomata is in combat, her Energy Generation Rate is increased by 25%.

talents.name: Curious Left Tail
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Sharpen Claws
talents.desc: When Nekomata uses her EX Special Attack, her CRIT Rate increases by 7% for 15s, stacking up to 2 times, with each stack's duration being calculated separately.

talents.name: Lucky Right Tail
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Predator Lineage
talents.desc: When Nekomata launches a Chain Attack or uses her Ultimate, her CRIT DMG increases by 18%, stacking up to 3 times, and expiring when she's no longer in-combat. This effect gains maximum stacks immediately on defeating an enemy.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"The best mackerel is always the one you haven't eaten yet~\" — Nekomiya Mana. Spirited and mischievous, she likes to play tricks on others. Your wallet is her wallet. (Really... It's hers now.) Athletic and daring, no Hollow is too dangerous for her. \"Cats love fish\" is actually an incorrect stereotype. But Nekomata does love fish... She's seen a lot of cat-astrophy and \"curiosity killed the cat\" moments, and seen many a secret that can't be told.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Nicole is an A-rank Ether Support Agent whose primary role is to amplify the damage of your damage dealers in many ways. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"From her iconic massive DEF Shred debuff, to DMG% debuffs, CRIT Rate increases, to Ether DMG Bonus boosts and providing Quick Assists with minimal field time, she has it all. Let’s look into how to play this supportive powerhouse.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Nicole’s main mechanic lies in her Core Passive. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"At max level, it debuffs enemy DEF by upwards of 40% for 3.5s whenever an enemy receives damage from an Energy Field or enhanced bullets (which she gains via Specials, EX Specials, Chain Attacks and Ultimates). The enhanced bullet mechanic is however rarely used on her, instead preferring Energy Fields which group enemies in its center. She has a few ways to generate them, being:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her EX Special;","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Ultimate;","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Chain Attack.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This is a HUGE debuff which can seriously amplify your party’s damage and take it to new heights.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" For a free Support character, Nicole puts in the work. However, there’s one main problem with it: the debuff only lasts 3.5s, which is a lot of the reason why she remains balanced. Her gameplay sums up to a matter of ensuring full uptime on her DEF Shred for your damage dealers to deal massive amounts of burst damage. Here’s how to handle that:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Nicole’s EX Special can be charged for a short duration, which deals DMG at the muzzle of her cannon, and when fully charged she shoots her longest-lasting energy field. Use this before casting Ultimates or other kinds of lengthy charged attacks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Nicole’s Chain Attack and Ultimate are her best way to quickly get an Energy Field down, as it’s almost instant. They are best used when swap cancelling a DPS Agent’s animations to refresh uptime in the middle of a Stun combo (or on Anomaly agents, as an extra source of uptime which doesn’t require Energy).","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Nicole’s Energy Fields linger for a short duration and damage enemies in its radius (full charge EX being the longest lingering hitbox). During that entire time period, the 3.5s DEF Shred duration is constantly refreshed on every hit, up until the last hit where the 3.5s ticks down and the debuff expires. Keep this in mind when trying to refresh Nicole’s DEF Shred for maximum uptime. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This basically sums up Nicole’s entire gameplay. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Ultimate and EX Special attacks trigger Quick Assists if you want to make use of them (for a set like Astral Voice for example). You never want her on the field unless it’s to cast a Chain Attack, Ultimate or EX Special, as you’d be wasting valuable time that can be spent on your DPS Agents. It can get extremely mechanically complex to weave her in the midst of a DPS Agent’s rotation, especially during Stun. With Anomaly characters, it’s much easier to ensure uptime on key abilities since Stun windows are rarely exploitable.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Quick explanation on her build: ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"it should be noted Nicole deals a lot of her damage via Ether Corruption Anomalies, so if you want to build her for damage, Anomaly is the most optimal path","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". Beyond that, ensure her supportive capabilities are at their maximum. Investment on Nicole is negligible as all she needs is Energy Regen for EX Special uptime (and a maxed out Core Passive, of course).","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Also worth noting that DEF Shred and PEN Ratio negatively affect the impact they have on enemies when paired together due to how damage is calculated","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" — avoid pairing Nicole and Rina in a Double Support team setup for example, or building PEN Ratio on your Disc Drives/W-Engines if Nicole is present in the team.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Even without exploiting Nicole’s Additional Ability reserved to Ether teams (which only adds to her value in those), she remains one of the most versatile Support Agents, and while she doesn’t function with Rupture Agents as they completely ignore her DEF Shred capabilities, with any Attack or Anomaly DPS Agents she’s always one of the strongest options available. The only thing stopping the average Proxy from fully utilizing Nicole is her DEF Shred uptime — no way around this issue, you’ll need to pay attention and optimize. While her Mindscape 1 helps very slightly with this, it’s not enough to compensate for the extremely short duration on the DEF Shred and will require careful planning from the Nicole player. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"However, so long as you learn how to work around her mechanics properly, she’s one of the best Support Agents in the game. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"At a baseline, Nicole remains an extremely simplistic Agent to use as only 3 of her abilities are worth caring about. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This is especially true in Anomaly teams where timing certain abilities like her Ultimate is rarely an issue, however ensuring maximum uptime on her DEF Shred remains difficult.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In conclusion, Nicole is one of the strongest and cheapest Support Agents to build,","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" who slots in a wide variety of teams as one of the best options in almost every situation (aside from Rupture Agents). Considering her status as a free Agent, she’ll end up a must-build on lots of Proxies’ accounts, if they desire to clear endgame contents as smoothly as possible.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Amazing DEF Shred debuff that amplifies your party’s DMG by a ton.
