build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency = ATK% > PEN = FLAT ATK

talents.name: Supercharged Bomb
talents.desc: The DMG and the Anomaly Buildup inflicted by Nicole’s EX Special Attack increases by 16%. For each additional 0.1s of charging when Nicole activates her EX Special Attack, the duration of the energy field created at the target location increases by 0.15s.

talents.name: Charging Device
talents.desc: Nicole recovers 5 Energy when Core Passive: Mechanical Case's debuff is triggered. This effect can trigger once every 15s.

talents.name: A Hare’s Cunning
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Field Expansion
talents.desc: When Nicole uses her EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, the diameter of the energy field generated at the target location is increased by 3m.

talents.name: Industry Star
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Corrupting Energy Field
talents.desc: When Nicole’s energy fields deal DMG to an enemy, all squad members CRIT Rate against that enemy increases by 1.5%, stacking up to 10 times, and lasting 12s. The duration of each stack is calculated separately.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The leader of the odd-job agency the Cunning Hares, who accept all kinds of Hollow-related commissions. She's been on the streets for many years, and has a reputation among her peers as being exceedingly cunning. She's been blacklisted by many clients due to her all-or nothing approach. She loves money, but is surprisingly bad at managing it, leaving the \nCunning Hares constantly on the edge of bankruptcy and owing many debts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Pan Yinhu is an A-rank Physical Defender Agent whose primary specialties include buffing Sheer Force, healing the party and increasing damage taken by enemies to enhance teammates, particularly Rupture Agents.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His kit is extremely simple by design, meaning he is easy to pick up for any Proxies wanting to try him out — simple yet effective characterizes this Agent. Only 3 of his abilities are particularly important so we will only detail them: his EX Special, his Special and his Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"First of all, let’s discuss Pan Yinhu’s Ultimate: it deals high Physical DMG and at max level, heals the entire squad for up to 1.6% HP/s per second over 8s (for a total of 12.8% HP) on top of an extra 1060 HP. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"On most Agents, you can expect this healing to equal between 15 to 20% of their HP, which is a good chunk of help towards keeping your squad alive","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". It can be used whenever your teammates need healing, or if you somehow aren’t taking damage, there is no specific timing to use it. It is worth noting Pan Yinhu’s Mindscape 4 further increases this healing effect by providing additional healing if Agents are hit by an attack (equivalent to 50% of the flat HP healing given by the Ultimate).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pan Yinhu’s Special is the more interesting part of his kit and allows him to access his buffing potential. Using EX Special restores 3 points of “Break Force”, a resource he can use to cast Specials called “Touch of Death”. There are a few reasons to execute both of these abilities:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using EX Special accesses the Quick Assist of the previous member in the squad, and it activates Pan Yinhu’s “Meridian Flow” effect provided by his Core Passive. Meridian Flow converts a certain percentage of his ATK into Sheer Force for the character who uses this Quick Assist at up to 540 points (Mindscape 0) or 720 points (Mindscape 6). At max Core Passive level, the ATK requirement to maximize the buff (both at Mindscape 0 and Mindscape 6) is 3000 points. This effect lasts 25s.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using Touch of Death applies the “Depleted Qi” effect to enemies hit if his Additional Ability is activated, which increases their DMG taken by 20% (with an extra 10% boost at Mindscape 1). This effect lasts 10s.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Therefore, Pan Yinhu’s simple gameplay sums up to the following steps:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use EX Special to buff the Sheer Force of the previous character in the squad by triggering a Quick Assist (ideally a Rupture damage dealer) every 25s;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use 1 Touch of Death to increase the DMG taken by enemies every 10s (can be done 3 times with EX Special);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use Ultimate if teammates need healing or when readily available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This is enough to cover his gameplay — ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Pan Yinhu doesn’t deal much damage on his own and instead relies on Rupture damage dealers like Yixuan to handle the heavy lifting.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" He therefore doesn’t want to take up much field time, and his kit is perfect for that.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Pan Yinhu is nonetheless introduced as a pretty good contender in the meta to buff Rupture agents.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" As the only direct buffer of Sheer Force on his release, he fills a unique role with Rupture damage dealers like Yixuan to increase their damage by a lot — as general ATK increasing supports are less favourable to buff the Sheer Force of Rupture agents than Pan Yinhu’s buff. This makes him fill a niche, but appreciated role, not to mention the healing provided by his Ultimate gives extra comfort in battle, allowing you to tank a few enemy hits without budging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In conclusion, Pan Yinhu is an easy, plug-and-play Support for Rupture Agents, able to buff their Sheer Force DMG effectively while keeping a simplistic playstyle and a good balance between buffing capabilities and survivability via the healing his Ultimate provides.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Overall a potent Support Agent which does exactly what you expect him to in an effective way.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Extremely simple plug-and-play Support Agent — anyone can pick him up. Basically the equivalent of Lucy for Sheer Force-scaling Agents, with very low field time and effective buffs;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The only Sheer Force buffer at the time of his release, a unique and valuable role;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rare presence of healing in his kit which helps with party survivability;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very low-cost Agent who needs little resources investment-wise aside from his ATK requirement;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Scales well with Mindscapes while retaining his functionality at a baseline.\n","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Only usable with Rupture Agents — very specialized character (excels in his niche but doesn't have the generalist potential of Agents like Nicole/Lucy);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Must be placed before the DPS Agent in the party which can make some team options awkward (with characters like Trigger);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a scarce amount of effective W-Engine options.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"3000+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10000+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Note:","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Pan Yinhu is a very low-cost Agent, as he only needs to meet his 3000 ATK requirement. Other than that, if you wish to optimize build him for damage with as much CRIT as possible (this isn't necessary though, we recommend you spare the resources).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Assist, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2.

On activating Ultimate: A Feast Fit for an Emperor!, gain the Backup Provisions effect. Whenever any character in the squad loses HP, consume the Backup Provisions effect to instantly restore 50% of the HP recovered with Ultimate: A Feast Fit for an Emperor!'s instant HP recovery effect. This effect cannot stack.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Piper Wheel is an A-Rank Physical Anomaly Agent who specializes in dealing a lot of Anomaly damage quickly in short burst windows by using her EX Special spin attacks","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". This is the core part of her gameplay and it explains a lot of her synergies and use cases.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"It might sound a little simple to only reduce Piper to an Anomaly Agent who spins to deal damage, but frankly that much is enough for her to perform","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Pretty much all she ever wants to do is spin around, apply Physical Anomaly on enemies, and deal massive amounts of Assault and Disorder damage. She has a few tools to do this so we’ll explain them one by one.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"First of all, let’s discuss her Basic Attacks and her Assists. For the most part, all of them will go unused (Assists may be used in some rare situations but they do nothing in particular compared to other Agents, just the run-of-the-mill burst of damage on Quick Assists and high Daze output on Defensive Assists). Overall, you can ignore these abilities and focus on her Dodge, Special and her Ultimate/Chain, the more interesting parts of her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate and Chain attacks function as simple bursts of Anomaly application and damage – overall they’re pretty good to use if you can make use of them. It should be noted Piper’s Anomaly application on her Ultimate is pretty big, so make sure not to waste any of it in case your Assault anomaly is on cooldown (remember Anomalies of the same element have a 3 second-long internal cooldown which, especially on Piper and depending on the enemy you’re facing, can lead you to waste some Anomaly application).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Special is the more interesting part of her kit. Piper is one of the rare Agents in the game who actually want to make use of their regular Special (Piper’s Basic Attacks are often not favourable due to being slow and not applying as much Anomaly). What Piper’s Special does, without enough Energy available to use her EX Special, is it makes her enter a “Tire Spin” state. In this state, she can spin for a short duration.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It has a total of 3 stages, which look like a slow wind-up during the first, a proper spin during the second, and finally the third is reached once charged for about 3 seconds, after which she automatically follows up with a special attack called “One Trillion Tons” which deals a good chunk of extra damage and Anomaly. Stage 1 lasts about a second, which can be skipped after using Basic 3 (unused), a Dash Attack or a Dodge Counter. Generally speaking, using a Dash Attack or a Dodge Counter to access Stage 2 of Tire Spin leads to improved damage. It’s possible to quickly cancel the lag that Piper has at the end of One Trillion Tons with a Dodge, after which it is possible to follow up with a Dash Attack into a Tire Spin stage 2 and 3. This is her primary means of dealing damage and applying Anomaly when Piper doesn’t have Energy available. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"It is also possible to switch out of One Trillion Tons and swap cancel the animation if your other party members need to take the spotlight.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"However, when Piper does have enough Energy available, she gets to use her EX Special instead. Upon reaching Tire Spin Stage 3 as normal, she can perform “Engine Spin” for an extra 3 seconds, during which she deals greatly increased DMG and applies Anomaly extremely quickly, one of the fastest Anomaly applications in the game. When Piper has completed her Spin duration or her Energy drops to 20, she automatically follows up with an enhanced version of One Trillion Tons called “Really Heavy”. The Anomaly application on this skill is similarly really high, and it’s recommended to switch out of it as this will in most cases conclude her rotation, after which you’ll need to set up your other characters once again.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"During both Spin states, Piper’s DMG Taken is reduced by 40% and her Anti Interrupt level is increased. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This means she will very rarely get interrupted by enemy attacks and can keep spinning even though she’s getting hit. Managing HP with Piper can be a challenge, since during her EX Special it’s strongly recommended to perform it all the way through and it’s difficult to stay out of range of enemy attacks. Mindscape 2 does help with this, but only to a small extent since you’ll need to stay close to hit enemies with your Spins no matter what.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additionally, thanks to Piper’s Core Passive, she will gain a stack of “Power” for every enemy hit by an instance of damage of her EX Special or Ultimate. At a maximum of 20 stacks, they each increase her Physical Anomaly Buildup Rate by 4% for a total of 80% (at max level). This is a good chunk of the reason why her Anomaly application is so high. On top of this however, thanks to her Additional Ability she also gives the whole squad (including herself) 18% increased damage as long as she’s at 20 stacks of Power. Each stack lasts 12 seconds, so the buff can last into other character rotations if they have big damaging abilities. The uptime is further guaranteed by her Mindscapes 1 and 6. Mindscape 4 also indirectly helps with EX Special uptime.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"So overall, Piper’s gameplay limits itself to the following simple steps:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Watch out for Anomaly cooldowns and use your abilities accordingly to quickly fill Anomaly bars: Special, EX Special, Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attacks are good to execute when possible (although Piper’s teams rarely tend to stun enemies well).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Spin to Win (make sure to dodge some enemy attacks and keep a close eye on your HP though).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Other than that, it’s mostly a matter of ensuring your supports are used properly. Piper really enjoys having a Sub-DPS Anomaly applicator like Burnice or Vivian so keep a close eye on their uptimes but beyond that, have fun spinning!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Piper’s position in the meta has a long history of people being unaware of her potential","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". However, Piper is without a doubt the best A-rank DPS currently and gets close to Jane in terms of physical Anomaly potential. Piper also works with less field time than Jane and buffs the whole party’s damage by a small amount, so she’s more open to diverse kinds of teammates. Her damage is especially good with Mindscapes so she’s definitely a character you can consider building the more Mindscapes you have of her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In conclusion, Piper is a pretty simple spin-to-win type DPS who actually deals remarkable damage for an A-rank Agent.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" In spite of her simplistic gameplay, her damage pays off and while her optimal team options may require certain limited teammates, thanks to her ease of use and ease of obtention, she’s definitely a potent damage dealer you can consider building to help you with clearing all kinds of endgame contents in Zenless Zone Zero.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fantastic Assault Anomaly damage for an A-rank Agent;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"One of the fastest Anomaly appliers in the game with her EX Special spin, able to apply Assault, Flinched and Disorder at lightspeed;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very F2P-friendly — good F2P build and W-engine choices/requirements, scales well off of Mindscapes without being necessary;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Scales amazingly well off of Mindscapes – goes from acceptable damage to particularly noteworthy;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Able to buff her own and other teammates’ damage with her Additional Ability, allowing for good synergies in Disorder teams with multiple Anomaly characters;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Spin To Win!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

While she can’t be interrupted, it can be problematic in teams that don’t run characters able to provide sustain over long fights;","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Little damage potential without EX Specials available — big downtime that is good to fill in, but limits team choices even further.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Leisure Moment
talents.desc: When Piper's Special Attack: Tire Spin, EX Special Attack: Engine Spin, or Ultimate hits an enemy with a spinning slash, there is a 50% chance to gain an additional stack of Power. The maximum stack limit of Power is increased to 30.

talents.name: Motivation
talents.desc: During Special Attack: Tire Spin and EX Special Attack: Engine Spin, Piper's movement speed increases. When using Special Attack: One Trillion Tons, EX Special Attack: Really Heavy, or Ultimate to launch a downward smash that hits an enemy, the Physical DMG dealt by the move is increased by 10%. For each stack of Power, this buff is further increased by 1%.

talents.name: Truck Expert
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Refined Techniques
talents.desc: Whenever a squad member inflicts an Attribute Anomaly on an enemy, Piper recovers 20 Energy. This effect can trigger once every 30s.

talents.name: Personal Hobbies
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Mild Excitement
talents.desc: Increases the duration limit of EX Special Attack: Engine Spin by 2s and extends the duration of Power by 4s.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hmph, what in the world is so appealing about lottery tickets anyway? Victory and defeat are completely out of your own control!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Pulchra is our latest A Rank and the first Physical Stun Agent","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Despite not being S Rank, she can certainly find a place in quite a number of teams as a competitive choice! Pulchra, like S0 Anby who releases alongside her, is all about the new damage type and mechanic - Aftershock, which revolves around dealing damage and Daze via triggers instead of directly through abilities (Similar to how Burnice’s Afterburn works). Unlike S0 Anby, Pulchra’s Aftershocks all consist of off-field attacks that can occur while you’re playing another Agent! ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This fact is the defining feature of Pulchra’s playstyle and it’s no exaggeration to say that she’ll be attacking more from off field than she will from on field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pulchra’s off-field Aftershock attacks are tied to her unique resource gauge, which takes the form of a row of Jagged Fangs consisting of 6 Fangs initially but reaching up to 8 at M6. To accumulate these Fangs Pulchra must first enter Hunter’s Gait, a special state granted each time she uses an EX-Special Attack, Assist Follow-Up, Chain Attack or Ultimate, upon doing so she’ll fully recover all her Fangs as well as gain a 30% increased Daze multiplier.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When off-field and while she’s in Hunters Gait with Fangs available, whenever another Agent lands a Heavy Attack with either a Special Attack or EX-Special Attack, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Pulchra will start her sequence of Aftershock attacks consisting of multiple instances of her Special Attack: Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Each Rending Claw will consume 1 Fang out of Pulchra’s resource gauge and after the first Rending Claw is triggered via a Heavy Special/EX, every subsequent attack landed by an ally will trigger a Rending Claw until Pulchra’s resource gauge is empty. As an extra bonus when consuming the last Fang of her resource gauge, Pulchra’s final Rending Claw will be enhanced.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This creates the incredibly simple playstyle of landing an ability that refreshes Pulchra’s Hunter’s Gait and Fangs, swapping off her, landing a heavy attack with an ally's Special or EX and then unloading all of Pulchra’s Fangs with your choice of ally attacks until she’s empty, rinse, repeat. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When looking to optimize this playstyle it’s worth noting that her most seamless and effective means of easily accessing Hunter’s Gait is her Evasive Assist + Assist Follow-up and her EX-Special Attack. Here is an example of how a Pulchra Rotation might play out at M0:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Evasive Assist: Contract - Outsourced Combat","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Independent Pricing","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Swap","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Allied Heavy EX/Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow x 5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow (Finisher)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Oh, Time to Play?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Swap","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Allied Heavy EX/Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow x 5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow (Finisher)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outside of this, Pulchra brings one more thing to the table thanks to her Additional Ability: Business Partner. While active, any time she hits an enemy with her Special Attack: Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow, EX-Special Attack, Assist Follow-Up, Chain or Ultimate she applies Binding Trap for 15 seconds. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"While Binding Trap is active, the entire squad's Aftershock DMG is increased by 30% and at M6 this applies to all damage instead of just Aftershock!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To summarize, what makes Pulchra unique is her ability to deal considerable damage without being on the field for most part","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - this frees up field time for the rest of your agents to do what they need to and makes her a potent pick for teams that favor this playstyle. In addition to this, she is a great carrier of either the Astral Voice or Proto Punk Disc Drive Sets, which when combined with her Additional Ability, make for some reasonable team buffs for an A ranked stunner (especially at M6). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While she definitely has her place, she has a few downsides. Namely, the fact that one of her best Hunter’s Gait enablers (the combo of Evasive Assist + Assist Follow-up) consumes 2 Assist points instead of the standard 1, and the fact that before M6, she has limited buffing capabilities outside of Aftershock focused teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: [CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK] or [Anomaly Profiency > ATK% > PEN > ATK]

talents.name: Self-Interest
talents.desc: When dealing DMG to enemies affected by Binding Trap, increase own CRIT Rate by 10%.

talents.name: Opportunistic
talents.desc: While in the Hunter's Gait state from Core Passive: Hunter's Instinct, Pulchra's ATK is increased by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Territorial
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Joy of the Hunt
talents.desc: Reduces Energy Cost of activating EX Special Attack: Rending Claw - Flashstep by 5.

talents.name: Tail Game
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Behind the Mask
talents.desc: Special Attack: Rending Claw - Nightmare Shadow's DMG is increased by 15%, and the number of times the repeated attack can trigger is increased by 2. Additional Ability: Business Partner's Binding Trap effect now also applies to all damage types, not just Aftershock DMG.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Qingyi is an Electric S-Rank Melee Stun Agent, with strong Combo attacks that overwhelm enemies with Daze and amplify Stun damage multipliers to next level. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This unique combination makes Qingyi one of the top Support/Stun characters in the game, especially valuable for burst DPS aiming to maximize damage during the Stun window.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"However, as a combo-based character, Qingyi requires significant field time to be played optimally. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"You can expect her to dominate the majority of the team's on-field time while the enemy is not Stunned.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi's kit revolves around building and spending her unique resource gauge, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Flash Connect Voltage, or simply Voltage","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". All of Qingyi’s Electric damage attacks generate Voltage, which she can store up to 100 units. Voltage is essential for activating her empowered Basic Attack, Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, which requires a minimum of 75 Voltage. This attack is important for maximizing Daze potential and applying her powerful Stun damage multiplier. Qingyi’s primary objective on the field is to build and spend Voltage as quickly and efficiently as possible. In order to learn how to do that, let’s take an in-depth look at her abilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi's Basic Attack sequence consists of four attacks and a charged Basic Attack, accessible by pressing and holding. Each of these attacks have multiple variants – some being must-use, while others being worthless.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first two attacks deal Physical Damage. These are relatively weak compared to her later attacks and should be not used whenever possible - the reason being 3rd and 4th attack combo being superior in damage, able to generate Voltage, making it important that you try to minimize these attacks to only be used during any downtime. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The third attack is a multi-hit Electric assault that generates significant Voltage and can be repeated indefinitely by rapidly tapping the Basic Attack button. This attack is essential for Voltage generation and can be combined with Dodges to maintain positioning without interrupting the combo.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After sustaining the third attack for a set period of time, Qingyi emits a flash, empowering her fourth attack. It is recommended to finish off the Basic Attack combo at this point. Her 4th attack can be immediately executed by halting execution of the 3rd attack. This final stage of the combo comes in two variants – Standard and Empowered, with the latter requiring flash mentioned earlier (which takes around 1.3-1.5 seconds of continuously tapping Basic Attack 3) both of these deal substantial Electric damage and generate more Voltage, especially in its empowered form, which should always be prioritized.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi can also charge her Basic Attack for a powerful variant by holding it down. The unempowered charge is weak, but the empowered version unleashes a six-part sequence of dashing attacks, ending in a final smash.  It features high damage, Daze multipliers and can access her Core Passive. It can be ended early by releasing the hold, causing her to skip to final smash at the cost of other dash attacks. While executing the final smash, Qingyi becomes Invulnerable and if you can time it just before the enemy strikes, she performs a Perfect Dodge. This empowered sequence is vital for Qingyi’s rotation and should be the focal point of her gameplay.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To gain access to the empowered variant of her held Basic Attack, Qingyi must first have at least 75 Voltage, after which she’ll consume all of it in order to execute the empowered attack sequence. Any voltage consumed over the minimum 75 required will grant the attack an additional 1% damage and 0.5% Daze for a total possible increase of 25% increased damage and 12.5% increased Daze at 100 voltage. However despite this bonus, it is generally recommended to execute more frequent empowered Basic Attacks instead. As an extra bonus when executing Qingyi empowered Held Basic Attack, Basic Part 3 and Basic Part 4 she gains Anti-Interrupt and 40% Damage Reduction.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi's standard Special Attack is rarely used, but her EX-Special is pivotal to her playstyle. This ability delivers a powerful Electric strike, generating Voltage and strong Daze, and allows Qingyi to skip directly to the third stage of her Basic Attack combo when immediately followed by tapping the Basic Attack. This interaction forms the backbone of Qingyi's optimal combo sequence:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX-Special Attack: Moonlit Begonia","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap until empowered P4 is available and Voltage is close to 75)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 75 Voltage)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This combo unleashes a large amount of Daze and fully utilizes Qingyi’s kit. The EX-Special can be charged by holding it, increasing the energy cost from 60 to 80, allowing for increased damage, Voltage generation and Daze but at the cost of fewer combo opportunities. Whether to use the standard or charged EX depends on the player's preference for frequency versus power.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A tip for Qingyi’s EX-Special would be that it can miss some of its strikes unless you’re in very close proximity to your target resulting in less Daze, damage and Voltage so stick as close to enemies as possible when using this ability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi’s Chain attack and Ultimate both deliver powerful Electric strikes with solid multiplier values. Qingyi’s Chain attack can be used on Bosses for some additional damage and Voltage generation but generally isn’t as useful to use as a supportive or damage focused Chain from the rest of your team on Elite and Normal enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi’s Dash Attack simply executes a forward strike dealing Physical Damage. Qingyi’s Dodge Counter is another powerful skill. It allows her to skip the first two stages of her Basic Attack combo and jump straight into the third, dealing significant Daze and generating Voltage. This ability enables an alternative combo sequence without relying on EX:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Lingering Sentiments","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap until empowered P4 is available and Voltage is close to 75)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 75 Voltage)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For a High Voltage & Daze Combo using both EX and Dodge Counter:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Lingering Sentiments","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Moonlit Begonia","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 85 -100 Voltage)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi’s Quick Assist and Assist Follow-up don’t do anything special and simply deal Electric damage, Daze and generate some Voltage. These moves generally aren’t used though as Qingyi much prefers to spend all her time on field executing combos or making use of Dodge Counters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi's Core Passive revolves around the Subjugation debuff, which increases the Stun damage multiplier on enemies by 4% per stack when their Daze bar is maxed. Subjugation can stack up to 20 times, potentially raising a boss’s stun damage multiplier from 150% to 230% lasting until they recover from Stun.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Qingyi applies Subjugation through her empowered charged Basic Attack, making it essential to her supportive capabilities. Final smash applies 5 Subjugation stacks and 1 additional stack per Dash Attack executed before for a total of 10 stacks. Thus requiring her to execute 2 empowered combos to get full benefit from her Core Passive, however against non-boss enemies, Qingyi applies double Subjugation stacks, allowing her to reach maximum stacks with a single empowered charged Basic Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additionally, if you end your empowered charged Basic Attack early to take advantage of the Dodge Component of the ability and manage to land it, the final smash will be set to 10 Subjugation stacks regardless of how many Dash Attacks were executed prior.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Wrapping up her kit, Qingyi’s Additional Ability grants her 20% increased Daze to her Basics (which make up a big chunk of her overall Daze capabilities) and 6 Flat Combat Attack for every point of Impact she has over 120 up to a maximum of 600. In endgame gear with an Impact-increasing W-engine (Preferably with a Combat Impact% Bonus) it is possible to max out this bonus consistently,  granting Qingyi a nice bit of bonus damage. What makes this Additional Ability so great though is that all that’s needed to activate it is teaming Qingyi with ANY Combat character or of course a member of her faction.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Qingyi stands out as one of the best Stunning characters in the game, thanks to her large and universal Stun damage amplification and solid Daze output. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"However, her demanding playstyle requires her to occupy the majority of field time outside the Stun window to maximize her Voltage generation and Subjugation stacks application. While this might not suit every player, Qingyi’s position at the top of the meta is unquestionable, making her a valuable addition to any team focused on Stun mechanics.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong Daze output capable of stunning enemies in short order.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Satisfying combo playstyle that after some practice flows smoothly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple Damage Reductions, Anti-Interrupt buffs and Immunities throughout all of her combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Applies a completely Generic and tremendous Damage Amplification during the Stun window allowing burst DPS to reach new heights.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can effortlessly slot into almost any team thanks to her flexible Additional Ability requirements.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires a massive amount of the team's field time outside of the Stun window.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Combos take a good chunk of time to fully execute, sometimes making combat encounters awkward.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"May not always be able to fully unleash all 20 stacks of Subjugation on Boss enemies if they’re Stunned too fast or Qingyi can’t generate enough Voltage in time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE > CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Insulation Breakdown
talents.desc: When Qingyi enters combat, Flash Connect Voltage is instantly restored to its maximum, and the accumulation rate is increased by 30%. When using her Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, if Flash Connect Voltage is at its maximum, the attack will reduce the defense of the enemy it hits by 15%, and Qingyi's CRIT Rate against that enemy will increase by 20% for 15s.

talents.name: Minimal Effort, Maximum Impact
talents.desc: The Stun DMG Multiplier increase provided by each stack of Subjugation in Core Passive: Eternal Seasons increases to 135% of its original value. When Qingyi's attack hits an enemy and the stacks of Subjugation she applies reaches its maximum stacks, her Daze dealt to the target increases by 15%.

talents.name: Drink Hot Water
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Stable Arc Barrier
talents.desc: Upon entering or exiting Flash Connect state, gain a shield equal to 10% of Qingyi's max HP. If a previous shield is still active when the shield effect refreshes, Qingyi generates 5 Energy. This Energy generation effect can be triggered once every 10s.

talents.name: Youthful Spirit
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Eight Meridians
talents.desc: The Interrupt Level of Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms is greatly increased, and the CRIT DMG is increased by an additional 100%. When Qingyi hits an enemy with her Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, the target's Resistance to all Attribute DMG is reduced by 20% for 15s.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has two pet Bangboo puppets she casts all her abilities with - they hang around on the field after she casts abilities for a short while before returning to her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the incredibly generic buff that while Bangboos are on the field Rina grants 25% of her PEN ratio + a flat amount up to a limit of 30% to all team members, increasing the whole team’s damage tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability increases all Shock durations from 10 seconds to 13 seconds resulting in higher Shock uptime and 30% more total damage if all Shocks have the chance to run their full duration (essential for Shock teams). Also grants the team 10% Electric damage while there is a Shocked enemy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pen Ratio buff is universal enough to always be helpful in any team and the Shock duration extension is unique enough that it’s unlikely Rina will become replaced too quickly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to understand and play outside of ensuring Rina’s Bangboo’s stay deployed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very high movement speed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many abilities last multiple seconds and occupy Rina’s Bangboos, restricting her from casting another ability until the last one finishes - this makes the use of Rina’s abilities in quick succession challenging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bangboos need to be constantly redeployed in order to take advantage of Rina’s Pen Ratio buff, meaning you’ll need to stay on top of weaving her attacking in between your other characters as much as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her M1 is a big upgrade, giving her great QOL.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2000 - 2600+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Optional) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10500+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF:","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" 800+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anomaly Proficiency: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"200 - 300","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Optional) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"PEN RATIO: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"38% - 72%","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (72% Grants full 30% team buff at Core Passive 6) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = FLAT ATK

talents.name: Dance Duet
talents.desc: After being sent out to launch an attack, Drusilla and Anastella stay in place for an additional 5.5s before returning to Rina. The effect gained from Core Passive: Mini Destruction Partner by characters within 10m is increased to 130%.

talents.name: Master's Paragon
talents.desc: Upon entering combat or switching in, Rina's DMG increases by 15% for 12s. This effect can trigger once every 18s.

talents.name: Head Maid's Speciality
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Needle and Hammer
talents.desc: Rina's Energy Regen increases by 0.5/s when both Drusilla and Anastella are deployed. The effect ends when Drusilla or Anastella returns to Rina.

talents.name: Head Maid Perfectionist
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Stormy Night's Fright
talents.desc: When an EX Special Attack, Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, the entire squad's Electric DMG is increased by 15% for 8s.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A Midsummer Night's Dance. A delicate and gentle melody flows naturally through Rina's movements. Twisted Fate Concerto. Additional music performed by the dolls, best enjoyed with attentive ears. New World Symphony. Stirring, powerful, and elegant. Rina is as elegant as ever, even when beating people up. Silent Sonata Pathetique. The soundtrack that resonates in many people's minds when they see Rina step into the kitchen.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth is an A-Rank Electric Melee Defense Agent who is just a Support in disguise. He offers strong Anomaly buffs and Shields to both himself and a designated ally.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Seth contributes significantly to Daze and Anomaly buildup, making him a versatile addition to any team - and what's best, he doesn't need to spend a lot of time on the field to do what he does best!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth's abilities center around a unique resource called Resolve. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This resource fuels a powerful Enhanced Basic Attack, which triggers a Special Quick Assist for the character positioned before Seth in the squad order - unlike standard Quick Assists, which activate for the next character in line. Seth’s Quick Assist enhances the performance of the preceding squad member - granting them a Shield and a powerful Attribute Anomaly buff for an extended duration. Outside of his Chain Attacks, mastering Seth's kit requires understanding how to maximize this shield and buff for your chosen ally (to be chosen before the mission starts) while keeping Seth’s field time to a minimum.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s effectiveness hinges on his Core Passive - Protector, and Additional Ability - High Spirit as these are the core of his support capabilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Core Passive grants Seth a Shield equal to 80% of his initial ATK every time he uses his EX Special Attack, with a maximum cap of 3000 for 25 seconds and a 10-second cooldown. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The shield’s strength is tied to Seth’s initial ATK, meaning it remains unaffected by any in-combat ATK buffs.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" What you see on his stat page before a mission is what you get in battle. When Seth triggers a Quick Assist via his Charged Hold Basic Attack or Assist Follow-Up, the same Shield, with identical scaling, cap, and duration, is granted to the ally benefiting from the assist. Additionally, all squad members, including Seth, who are shielded by this effect, gain a significant 100 additional Anomaly Proficiency at max rank. However, due to the mechanics of Seth’s Shields, only himself and the preceding squad member in order can benefit from this buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth’s Additional Ability is simpler.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" It requires at least one squadmate to share Seth’s Attribute or Faction to activate. When active, Seth’s Chain Attack or Charged Hold Basic Attack reduces the enemy's Anomaly Buildup Resistance by 20% for 20 seconds. This debuff significantly enhances Anomaly team performance, increasing overall damage and consistency by accelerating Anomaly application. Since both attacks that apply this effect are commonly used by Seth, maintaining this debuff almost permanently is straightforward and easy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth wields two distinct Basic Attack forms: a standard 4-part combo and a specialized Charged Hold Basic Attack. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"His standard combo is rarely employed","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", due to its lack of Resolve generation and contribution to team utility, thus we shall bypass its details and instead focus on the Charged Hold Basic Attack, which is far more crucial to Seth's role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Charged Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified requires and consumes 75% of his Resolve Bar to activate and will cause Seth to launch a flurry of lightning slashes followed by a large finishing move dealing moderate Daze and Electric Anomaly.This attack is irreplaceable for triggering his unique Quick Assist, which applies a shield to an ally, as well as for maintaining the Anomaly Resistance Reduction debuff on enemies. Because of this building and then spending the 75% Resolve to activate it should always be at the top of his priority list and thankfully is easily achievable thanks to his EX Special.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth's EX Special Attack is one of his most reliable and efficient methods for accumulating Resolve.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" By consuming 80 energy, Seth releases a barrage of heavy Electric attacks that inflict substantial Daze and Electric Anomaly damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"More importantly, this attack immediately grants Seth 75% Resolve","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", making it an essential component of his rotation. The synergy between the EX Special and his Charged Hold Basic Attack forms his primary combo. This combo should be employed whenever the energy is available, and when either Seth, his designated ally, or the enemy lacks the buffs or debuffs from his Core Passive or Additional Ability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's EX Special can be further enhanced by holding the EX button - charging the attack at cost of additional time.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" While this increases the damage, Daze, and Anomaly application, it does not affect Resolve generation","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". The additional charge time can be significant, but it can be shortened by executing the charge immediately following a Chain Attack, Ultimate, Dodge Counter, Assist Follow-Up, or Quick Assist. Furthermore, Seth can reduce the recovery time of the Charged EX by performing a Dash Cancel after the final strike, or by Swapping to another character while Seth completes the attack. While the Charged EX can provide a slight boost to Seth's damage, Daze, and Anomaly output, it is entirely optional. Skipping the charge in favor of the standard EX Special will not hinder Seth’s supportive capabilities and may even result in gaining extra field time for other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's Chain Attack and Ultimate both deal damage, apply Daze, and Anomaly effects compared to moves of their type for defense characters like Seth, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"but they also both generate 75% Resolve on use. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The resolve generation of the chain attack on top of the application/reapplication of Seth’s 20% Anomaly Resistance Reduction make it well worth using whenever you have a Chain Attack to spare. Utilizing Chain Attacks whenever possible, without causing a significant damage loss, reduces the pressure of relying solely on Seth’s EX Special to access his Charged Hold Basic Attack, while also keeping one of his most important supportive bonuses active more consistently. Seth’s Ultimate on the other hand sadly isn’t worth using as between his EX’s and Chain Attacks he more than Resolve he needs covered.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth’s Quick Assist is rather unremarkable and rarely used. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"However, the synergy between his Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up is where he shines. Using Seth’s Assist Follow-Up similarly to his Enhanced Hold Basic Attack triggers a Quick Assist, which, like the Basic Attack, can grant all of Seth’s Core Passive bonuses to a teammate. This makes it a viable alternative in combat, particularly when Resolve or energy is in short supply.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Seth emerges as a formidable Anomaly support powerhouse, yet his playstyle is refreshingly straightforward. He only requires the execution of one simple combo to effectively apply all his buffs, shields, and debuffs:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Standard Combo ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Thunder Shield Rush - High Voltage (Generates 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified (Consumes 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Team Mate Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite the simplicity of his core combo, Seth boasts an array of tricks, alternative combo sequences, and options to further enhance his performance. These elements collectively position him as a great character within the Anomaly archetype, offering both ease of use and depth for those willing to explore his full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High duration buff/debuff uptime and they are also easy to apply, which makes keeping them all active easy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Takes up minimal field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Offers decent Defensive shields.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants a big Anomaly efficiency bonus to himself and an ally of your choosing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Debuffs enemies causing them to lose 20% Anomaly Buildup Resistance of all element types.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can only consistently buff himself and 1 other teammate with his shield and Anomaly Efficiency.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Attack animations on most important attacks his EX Special and Charged Held Basic are on the slower side.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.desc: Upon entering battle, Seth immediately gains 75% Resolve. Hitting an enemy with Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified increases the move's accumulated Electric Anomaly Buildup by 35%.

talents.name: Distant Admiration
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Idealist
talents.desc: When Seth lands a finishing strike on an enemy with Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified, it deals additional damage equal to 500% of his ATK. The attack is guaranteed to trigger a CRIT, and CRIT DMG is increased by 60%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth, a rookie officer in the Public Security Criminal Investigation Special Response Team, is a key player in providing fire support during criminal investigations. He graduated at the top of his class in the academy and could have landed a higher position, but he chose the tougher path of the Special Response Team. His impressive profile makes him seem like a genius, but he's actually a hard worker who has had his own struggles. There have been times when he practiced the subjects he wasn't good at until he cried.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soldier 11 is an S-Rank Melee Fire Combat Agent having a simple but effective combat style, with some room for skillful play. Her kit is easy to understand, to execute and fits right into various combat scenarios and team compositions. While her damage isn’t Meta-Defining, she does just enough to hold her own in endgame content, making her a reasonable choice of investment until you set your eyes on Limited DPS considering she is available from the Standard Banner.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The entirety of her kit consists of simple direct damage dealing abilities almost exclusively, with the only exception being attacks which feature the presence of her Signature mechanic “Fire Suppression”. Such attacks are subject to a special timing mechanic, which states that when activating the ability in question “at the right moment”, she will use an Enhanced version of the attack instead. The so-called right moment requires you to execute the desired attack input roughly around the ending of the current attack animation without any other inputs beforehand aka no button mashing! To understand and get hang of this timing, we highly recommend messing around with her kit in VR mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her damage is balanced, assuming you’ll achieve Fire Suppression on most of her attacks, making pacing your attack input essential. Fortunately, Solder 11 has ways to forcefully use Fire Suppression on many of her attacks, thus even if you are not the best at executing her special timing mechanic, she is still playable at a good level. With that covered, let's discuss rewards Fire Suppression offers and how the rest of her kit plays out!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Basic Attack consists of a 4 part combo, which makes up for a bulk of her damage and will be used for the majority of her field time. At baseline, they deal very underwhelming Physical Damage but can be empowered via Fire Suppression. With the right timing, her Basic Attacks gain higher base multipliers, deal Fire Damage and bonus effects from her Core Passive. All this should make it clear that timing your attacks right should be your utmost priority.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Special Attack isn't worth using whereas her EX Special is very valuable. Her EX Special produces a massive Slash in front and around her, dealing strong Fire Damage to all enemies in radius and grants Soldier 11 a special Charge based buff. This buff grants her guaranteed Fire Suppression for next 8 attacks (regardless if timed correctly or not, buff does not stack) in next 15 seconds. Due to its high Energy costs and strong damage output, this ability is best saved for Stunned Boss enemies or in large AoE situations. Alternatively, it can be utilized for generating guaranteed Fire Suppression Charges in a pinch when you are not confident in landing correct timings in a particular combat scenario.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In a similar vein to her EX Special, her Chain Attack and Ultimate also deal strong cleave-based Fire Damage while granting her identical Fire Suppression Charge buff. As a primary DPS, her Ultimate should be your primary choice of usage unless running an alternative DPS option. If chosen, it is best to use Soldier 11’s Ultimate after the enemy is Stunned, to make use of Stun Damage Multiplier. That said, with the addition of these two methods to generate Fire Suppression Charges, it will be very rare for her to be without them. However, those who can avoid relying on these charges, will be able to use all of her strongest moves at most opportune times instead when the enemy is at their most vulnerable, leading to overall higher flexibility and damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soldier 11’s Dodge, Dodge Counter, Dash Attack and Assists are all standard attacks, except Dash Attack can be upgraded via Fire Suppression granting it higher base multipliers, Fire Damage and boost from her Core Passive.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rounding off her kit, she gains 2 strong Passives from her Core Passives and Additional Ability. As we discussed earlier, her Core Passive grants all attacks enhanced via Fire Suppression (Basic and Dash Attacks) a whopping 70% Damage Increase. This reinforces the importance of having these Charges or executing her attacks with right timing. Meanwhile, her Additional Ability is activated by having another character of the same Attribute or Faction as her in the team, granting her an unconditional 10% Fire Damage and an additional 22.5% Fire Damage when attacking Stunned enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, Soldier 11 presents herself as a decent DPS option having both - reasonably strong burst damage options when aligning her most powerful attacks with enemy Stun windows, as well as dealing decent sustained damage thanks to her constant access to Fire Suppression enhanced attacks. While playing her perfectly offers greater Flexibility, not doing so isn’t punishing, making her a great option to build early and serve you well until you settle on more premium teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly simple playstyle once you get the hang of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core Passive and Additional ability are a pile of free damage that doesn’t require you to do anything.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"No stand-out features other than decent damage output, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic attacks have a special “timed” mechanic, requiring you to pause a short moment in between each attack in order to deal maximum damage. This mechanic can be bypassed through the use of some abilities but should still be mastered to unlock Soldier 11’s full potential which won't be for everyone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Limited synergy with other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
