build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Rapid Heat
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 enters combat or switches in, if her Energy is less than 40, her Energy is recovered to 80. This effect can trigger once every 50s.

talents.name: Scorching Convergence
talents.desc: When triggering Fire Suppression, Basic Attack, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter DMG increases by 3%, up to 12 stacks, lasting 15s, with the duration of each stack calculated separately.

talents.name: Elite Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Indulgent Blaze
talents.desc: If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 1st, 2nd, or 3rd hit of Soldier 11's Basic Attack or a Dash Attack, Anti-Interrupt Level increases and DMG received is reduced by 18% during skill activation. If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 4th hit of her Basic Attack, she becomes invulnerable during skill activation.

talents.name: Perfect Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Scorching Flow
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 uses her EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When Fire Suppression is triggered, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, causing the current move to ignore 25% of the target's Fire RES.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A model soldier who follows orders and stays loyal to the mission... At least that's what Soldier 11 demands of herself. Weapons don't need emotions, and need only follow orders... At least that's what Soldier 11 tells herself. No matter how strong the enemy, just get fired up and face it head on... At least that's what Soldier 11 does. She's shed her weakness along with her name, leaving only resolve... At least that's what Soldier 11 thinks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Soukaku is an A-Rank Ice Support Agent whose primary role is to buff Ice Main DPS Agents to amplify the party’s overall damage while dealing good damage of her own","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". The core of her kit lies in her “Fly the Flag” and “Vortex” stack mechanics, so we’ll detail those first.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Vortex stacks are a consumable resource that Soukaku can use to buff the party’s damage and cast Enhanced Basic/Dash Attacks (although this latter feature is rarely used). They stack up to 3 times and she gains them in 3 ways:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1 Vortex stacks per use of her EX Special (low cost, easy to chain 3 together);","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1 Vortex stack when using her Chain Attack (rarely used);","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3 Vortex stacks when using her Ultimate.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Tapping Soukaku’s Special with enough Energy causes her to use her EX Special which releases wind currents in succession if pressed repeatedly. The low Energy cost makes it possible to use them 3 times one after the other to get max Vortex stacks without the aid of her Ultimate or Chain Attacks. A finishing move can be executed if not interrupted by Fly the Flag, however it is slow to execute and deals relatively low damage and as a result, using this finishing move is not favourable.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Vortex stacks are consumed when launching Fly the Flag, which is done by holding Special. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Consuming Vortex stacks allows Soukaku to buff the party’s Ice DMG by 20% for 22s via her Additional Ability. Additionally, launching Fly the Flag buffs Soukaku’s ATK by up to 1000 points for 22s, scaling directly with her own ATK. When launching Fly the Flag, she can activate a Quick Assist to the next character in the squad. Doing so will transfer the Fly the Flag ATK buff to the next Agent who entered via this Quick Assist, and in very rare cases this can also be done via a Chain Attack (although this basically never sees use). 1000 flat ATK is a massive buff, however it has the weakness of only applying to 1 Agent at a time, meaning it’s completely incompatible with secondary DPS characters. This causes Soukaku to see teambuilding restrictions, like with Vivian in a Miyabi team for example, where the two are better off paired with other Support Agents who benefit the whole party at once such as Lucy and Nicole instead of Soukaku.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With that being said, Soukaku has massive ATK and Ice DMG buffs that last for 22s.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" It’s really easy to guarantee full uptime on both so long as she is managed properly. Using her EX Special 3 times, or an Ultimate if available, into Fly The Flag is enough to activate all of her buffs in relatively quick succession. Granted, Soukaku carries a heavy weapon and has rather slow execution wielding it. To her credit however, the sheer buffing potential she holds for Ice Agents in particular is enough to justify her a solid position in several Ice teams.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"So in short, Soukaku’s primary Support gameplay sums up to the following:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Use EX Special 3 times OR Ultimate;","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Launch Fly the Flag and Quick Assist into your Main DPS to guarantee high damage buffs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Generally speaking, her Enhanced Basic Attacks and Chain Attacks are too slow to justify their damage potential. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"While Soukaku does deal higher damage than most Supports, to where some dedicated players even go as far as using her as a Main DPS, generally speaking the average player is better off solely investing into her ATK to guarantee Fly the Flag’s buff provides the full 1000 ATK to a Main DPS Ice Agent like Miyabi or Ellen in order to deal damage with them as the spotlight instead. This makes logical sense considering Soukaku’s class as a Support Agent.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Soukaku also accesses a small 10% Ice RES Shred for 8s when hitting an enemy with Fly the Flag via her Mindscape 4. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"While the uptime on this is low, it is entirely possible to quickly burst down enemies hit with a high-damaging attack such as an Ultimate or Miyabi’s max charge Shimotsuki attack. Overall, it only enhances her supportive potential for Ice Agents. Additionally, her Mindscape 1 increases the uptime on her main buffs (Ice DMG boost, Flat ATK) from 22s to 30s, which pretty much guarantees permanent uptime. These vertical upgrades justify Soukaku’s position as a strong Ice Agent buffer even better, not to mention her personal damage remains non-negligible compared to other Support Agents. In the meta, while she’s often overshadowed outside of Ice teams by other A-ranks like Lucy and Nicole, via her specialization towards buffing Ice Agents she finds herself a viable niche for when premium Supports like Astra Yao are unavailable to use, or even in some specific synergies like the Miyabi - Lycaon - Soukaku trio that can reach the highest of heights when fully optimized.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In conclusion, Soukaku is a dedicated Ice Support who finds some niche uses outside of Ice teams but is generally overshadowed. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"However, to support Ice Main DPS Agents, there is rarely any Support who can match her level of damage increasing capabilities. Her ability to scale well off of high investment thanks to her high personal damage, in spite of her low attack speed, cements her position as one of the prime Ice element buffers in Zenless Zone Zero.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gives herself an absurdly high Flat ATK buff, which she can transfer to the next character in the party via Quick Assist or Chain Attack with permanent uptime if managed properly;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the team an Ice DMG Bonus after consuming her Vortex charges, which is doable quickly and easily with permanent uptime if managed properly. Also shreds Ice RES for a short period of time with M4, leading go high Ice-specific buffing potential;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Surprisingly high damage potential with Mindscapes and a good build, not to be ignored on top of solid Ice Anomaly application. Overall one of the rare Supports who scale well with high investment;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’s free!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Trigger is an Electric S-Rank Ranged Agent who specializes in off-field Aftershock damage and Daze, as well as amplifying Stun DMG Multipliers of enemies, thus boosting your whole party’s damage significantly.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Without a doubt, all of these traits cement Trigger as a character who synergizes not only with Aftershock characters but powerhouses way beyond that scope, often filling the slot of both a Support and Stun at the same time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In essence, her gameplay is extremely simplistic which will satisfy the wants of a lot of players","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": the mechanic at the core of her gameplay is a bar located under her in-battle character icon called “Purge” that she can fill in her “Sniper Stance” using “Silenced Shots”. These three terms cover the majority of how she’s played.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Sniper Stance is entered by holding down Basic Attack.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Once this occurs, Trigger gets on the ground and starts automatically shooting ranged Silenced Shots at enemies. These charged shots each charge up to 25 Purge up to a maximum of 100, which means 4 shots fill up the whole bar. This initially appears blue, but can change to an orange-golden colour after using certain skills. During Sniper Stance, Trigger will automatically trigger a Perfect Dodge once every 8 seconds if attacked, and she’s also able to move to the side or backwards in the process. When the free perfect dodge isn’t up, she can still activate a Perfect Dodge by evading in any direction at the right timing. During Sniper Stance and after a Perfect Dodge, she can execute a Counter regardless of whether the dodge is automatic or manual, which deals significant damage to the target while also generating Purge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Once the Purge bar is filled up, Trigger is ready to switch out and deal Aftershock DMG right away. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As an added bonus after exiting Sniper Stance, she’ll automatically cast a “Finishing Move” which deals additional damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At this point, if the bar below Trigger is blue and she is switched out of the field, your other characters’ basic skills will be able to trigger “Harmonizing Shots”, consuming 3 Purge a maximum of once every 3 seconds. These are her off-field Aftershock attacks which contribute to a lot of her Daze and damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"However, there are two ways to enhance them.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first method is by using a heavy attack from either an EX Special, Assist Follow-Up or Ultimate of a character other than Trigger. This activates a special variant of Harmonizing Shots called “Tartarus” which inflicts extra damage and Daze but consumes 5 Purge instead of 3 and takes more field time. You can activate these enhanced Harmonizing Shots a total of 6 times every 20 seconds, 2 times per each type of attack. They also do not share a cooldown with standard Harmonizing shots, allowing them to be used back to back.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second method is by turning the Purge bar below Trigger’s icon from blue to gold. This is done via her EX Special or Ultimate, with the colour change of the Purge bar indicating she’s entered a new state called “Coordinated Support”. Coordinated Support’s benefit is allowing your Harmonizing Shots to completely ignore the 3 second cooldown and usual Purge cost for a number of shots while it’s active. After using Trigger’s EX Special the next 4 Harmonizing Shots have this effect and after using her Ultimate the next 6 do. Note Coordinated Support can last a total of 20 seconds and span up to 10 shots per iteration. Her Ultimate grants 12 seconds of duration and 6 shots and her EX grants 8 seconds and 4 shots. These can be stacked together if used in succession to max out both the shot and duration limit of Coordinated Support, this isn’t necessary though. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"It’s in fact recommended to space them out if you’re trying to optimize, as regular blue Aftershock attacks don’t share a cooldown with gold Aftershock attacks","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" so you can squeeze an extra couple instantaneous shots if you plan things properly (you can interpret it as your EX special giving you 5 instant shots instead of 4, and your Ultimate giving you 7 instant shots instead of 6).  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Any instance of Aftershock DMG that Trigger deals, which comprises any of her off-field attacks, passively increases the Stun DMG Multiplier of all enemies hit by 35% for 5 seconds which applies regardless of whether the enemy is stunned or not. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This is her Core Passive, and is one of the most important parts of Trigger’s kit and justifies a lot of her potential as a Support/buffing Agent, as it greatly increases all of your party’s damage against affected enemies. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Trigger’s Additional Ability increases her Daze dealt by Aftershocks by 1.5% for every 1% CRIT Rate she has over 40%. The maximum Daze increase from this Additional Ability is 75% which means the passive maxes out at 90% total CRIT Rate for Trigger, so aside from Impact this will be one of her main stat goals.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Other than that, Trigger’s Ultimate and EX Special both inflict a good amount of DMG and Daze in a single instance on top of granting Coordinated Support but also immediately activate a Quick Assist for the previous character in the team. This means you’ll typically want your DPS character to be swapped into and so they’ll be placed before Trigger in your party.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her other noteworthy skills are her Chain Attacks, which simply deal good amounts of DMG and when applicable Daze, as well as her Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up which, on the other hand, deal a massive amount of Daze and are a strong option for filling spare field time during combat or triggering W-Engine effects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All of these abilities, when put in relation to each other, allow us to piece together Trigger’s gameplay: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"and as we said when we introduced her, it’s very simplistic in essence","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". All you need to do is as follows:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Start off by doing 4 Silenced Shots in her Sniper Stance, followed by a Finishing Move;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Switch out to other Agents in your party and deal damage using them, while Trigger activates several Aftershock off-field attacks over time and stuns enemies off-field while increasing the Stun DMG Multiplier of those enemies;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Come back to Trigger to do Defensive Assists, EX Specials and Ultimates to stun enemies faster and deal more damage, as well as to refresh Purge when needed via more Silenced Shots.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Trigger’s Purge consumption is extremely low, which means she’s a low maintenance Agent in general, similar to Astra Yao in that sense.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" You only need to come back every once in a while to refresh Trigger’s Purge by doing an extra round of Silenced Shots. The most important gameplay tip to keep in mind when it comes to Trigger is learning to quickly release Basic Attack after your 4th Silenced Shot, which instantly cancels the animation and activates Finishing Move at no loss of damage — a good time save overall. Beyond that, there are some additional tricks to squeeze out some extra harmonizing shot triggers and minimize the restrictiveness of its three second cooldown, but the real secrets lie in optimizing the gameplay of your other Agents to make her shine!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In regards to Trigger’s position in the meta, her biggest flaw is that a lot of her potential is locked behind her first Mindscape and her signature W-Engine Spectral Gaze","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"; this is because it gives a -25% DEF Reduction to all enemies hit by her Aftershock attacks which is a massive buff to your entire party’s damage, and with her M1 she obtains an extra 20% Stun DMG Multiplier increase, going from 35% to 55%, further amplifying your whole party’s damage. Without a doubt, these two upgrades make Trigger one of this game’s top Supports, going beyond the scope of a Stun Agent, very close to Astra Yao in universal strength.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"However, even without those two upgrades included, Trigger remains an Agent who is of course especially strong in Aftershock teams","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" such as with Soldier 0 Anby, who not only enjoys the damage boosts, but also the on-field time that she gains from being paired up with Trigger who’s constantly off the field, as Dodge Counters are a big part of Soldier 0 Anby’s gameplay and you need to be on the field with her to execute them","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":". However, Trigger goes beyond those teams as a viable Stun Agent for DPS powerhouses like Yanagi and Evelyn","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", but also a mix of a Support Agent via her Stun DMG Multiplier debuff for just about any team that can appreciate her extra Daze, which aside from pure Anomaly teams that don’t have the Electric attribute such as Piper/Burnice, is pretty much anyone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To summarize, Trigger is a very strong all-rounder Agent who’s capable of not only dealing high Daze and good Aftershock DMG off-field, but can also serve as a mix of a Stun and Support Agent","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" for many teams, including the top contenders of the game’s meta. This makes Trigger one of the most valuable agents currently available, especially because of her ease of use, which a lot of the casual playerbase will enjoy. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Undoubtedly, these factors show that Trigger is a top-tier Agent herself.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong off-field presence via Aftershock attacks that inflict a lot of Daze and damage;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very simplistic in playstyle: just do 4 charged shots, swap out, rarely come back;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Automatic dodge mechanic and lots of range for extra comfort — very easy to avoid enemy attacks;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Universal Stun DMG Multiplier debuffer, making her a top choice way beyond Aftershock teams, not only as a Stun but as a Support too.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Really enjoys having her signature W-Engine, as it’s an amazing increase to her supportive presence via a practically permanent 25% DEF reduction on enemies. Her M1 is also amazing but both are expensive to acquire;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is locked out of several Anomaly team choices due to her Additional Ability activation condition, which hinders some of her massive team flexibility potential;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has trouble filling in for field time during the downtimes of certain Agents’ damage windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1700 - 2200+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Optional)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10000+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"750+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"IMPACT: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"162 - 186 +","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Most important stat)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"60 - 90%","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Most Stun characters have little use for sub-stats outside of improving their Sub DPS capabilities, but this is not the case for Trigger. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Stacking CRIT RATE grants her substantial DAZE% increase to all her Aftershock abilities, making it by far her highest priority stat after IMPACT% and DAZE% on gear. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Get as much CRIT RATE as you can until her additional ability caps out at 90%, then prioritize other stats (only doable with her signature).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"100 - 120%+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Optional)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE >= CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Sharpened Senses
talents.desc: The Stun DMG Multiplier applied through Core Passive: Soul-Searching Gaze is increased by an additional 20%. When activating Basic Attack: Harmonizing Shot, the cooldown is reduced to 2s. Purge gained upon hitting an enemy with the continuous fire or charged counter in Sniper Stance increases by 25%. Maximum Purge increases to 125.

talents.name: Ether Vision
talents.desc: Upon using an Aftershock, Trigger gains 1 stack of Hunter's Gaze. When executing a Finishing Move in Sniper Stance, Trigger gains 2 stacks of Hunter's Gaze. Each stack of Hunter's Gaze increases all squad members' CRIT DMG by 6%, stacking up to 4 times, and lasting 10s. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

talents.name: Homecoming
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Concealment
talents.desc: When Trigger enters or extends Coordinated Support, while the state is active, the next time other squad members trigger Basic Attack: Harmonizing Shot or Basic Attack: Harmonizing Shot - Tartarus, it will trigger Disconnect upon hitting an enemy, dealing additional DMG equal to 200% of Trigger's ATK and inflict Daze equal to 120% of Trigger's Impact. This skill has a relatively high Interrupt Level.

talents.name: Locked In
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Beyond the River of the Dead
talents.desc: Upon entering the battlefield, Trigger gains 5 Armor Break Rounds. For every 25 Purge consumed, Trigger gains 1 additional Armor Break Round, up to a maximum of 5 rounds. While possessing Armor Break Rounds, when Trigger hits a target in Sniper Stance, 1 Armor Break Round is consumed to deal additional Electric DMG equal to 1,200% of Trigger's ATK. In addition, this instance of DMG is additionally increased by 50%. This effect can trigger once every 0.2s.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Vivian is an Ether S-Rank Anomaly Agent whose defining characteristic is her ability to apply extra Anomaly damage based on your other Agents’ Anomaly damage.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" This element alone makes her fit into several teams and have high flexibility as a Sub-DPS type Agent, it defines the majority of her damage potential and is what her gameplay revolves around. Let’s first explain her kit and mechanics (fair warning: this will be lengthy).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"These “extra Anomalies” (to use simple terms) are called “Abloom”.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Vivian triggers Abloom whenever a character is suffering from any Attribute Anomaly of the 5 standard elements (Ether, Electric, Fire, Ice, Physical) and any character in the team uses their EX Special, once per ability used. Simultaneously, Basic Attack: “Featherbloom” is triggered. Featherbloom and Abloom both can activate off-field via any party member’s EX Special attack. This process can also happen whenever any Attribute Anomaly of the 5 elemental kinds is inflicted on an enemy once every 0.5s while her Additional Ability is active. However, in both cases this must come at the cost of 1 “Guard Feather” each time, which Vivian needs to generate on-field in several ways.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Generating a Guard Feather requires first converting it from a “Flight Feather”. Any available Flight Feathers, up to a maximum of 5, are converted into Guard Feathers via Vivian’s Basic Attack in the “Fluttering Frock” state during which she is suspended in mid-air. Fluttering Frock is activated if any Flight Feathers are available and in the following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Holding Basic Attack after using Basic Attack 4, Dodge Counter or Quick Assist;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using her Noblewoman - Waltz Basic attack (we cover this shortly after);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using an EX Special attack, Assist Follow-Up, Chain Attack or Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Holding Dodge cancels the state if it’s undesirable, and can additionally prevent Vivian from causing her to enter this state at all. If at any point Vivian switches out during the Fluttering Frock state, it automatically activates “Suspension” which is the attack responsible for converting Flight Feathers into Guard Feathers. Noblewoman - Waltz is a Basic Attack only available after pressing Basic Attack in the Noblewoman state, during which Vivian gets a free dodge once (which doesn’t give a Dodge Counter). It can be accessed in the following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After using Basic Attack 4, Dodge Counter or Quick Assist.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To generate Flight Feathers, which are necessary to convert into Guard Feathers for Vivian to use and trigger Abloom, different abilities give different amounts in the following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"1 Flight Feather after using Noblewoman - Waltz (this gives 1 additional Feather if it triggers a Perfect Dodge);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Flight Feathers after using Chain Attack;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Flight Feathers after using Assist Follow-Up;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"3 Flight Feathers after using EX Special attack;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"5 Flight Feathers after using Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All of these abilities are reliant on Energy of some kind or are slow to access consistently (Noblewoman - Waltz). ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This means Assist Follow-Ups are especially important to generate Flight Feathers with Vivian.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Upon converting available Flight Feathers by using Basic Attack in the Fluttering Frock state (called “Suspension”), Vivian is free to switch out to other characters for them to apply Attribute Anomalies for Vivian to trigger Abloom with.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Vivian’s Core Passive is responsible for triggering Abloom, and hence it is the top priority to focus on to maximize Vivian’s damage. It has the following effects","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When first engaging in combat, gain 2 Flight Feathers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When Basic Attack: Featherbloom hits a target inflicted with an Attribute Anomaly, trigger Abloom which deals damage depending on the Anomaly Proficiency of the inflicted Attribute Anomaly applied to the enemy, as well as the element of the Anomaly (balanced to give out the same damage roughly).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When Suspension or Featherbloom hit targets suffering any Attribute Anomaly, inflict a Damage Over Time effect called “Vivian’s Prophecy” which deals Ether DMG based on her ATK every 0.55s. This contributes to Anomaly DMG and ends when targets aren’t affected by Anomalies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional Ability: Corruption and Corruption Disorder DMG increases by 15%. Vivian now also consumes 1 Guard Feather and triggers Featherbloom (and Abloom) up to once every 0.5s when any Attribute Anomaly is inflicted on an enemy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Beyond the effects of all abilities listed above, all of Vivian’s combat skills inflict DMG and Daze as normal. Some are Physical DMG, but most are Ether DMG. It is important to level Vivian’s combat skills to an extent for extra Daze output to generate more Stun windows for your team on most enemies, even though only her Core Passive contributes to her Abloom DMG.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Based on this kit, the game plan with Vivian is therefore as follows:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Generate up to 5 Flight Feathers in any way (4 is fine depending on the team & available resources);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Enter Fluttering Frock state;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Switch out to automatically convert Flight Feathers into Guard Feathers and apply Anomalies to trigger Abloom for lots of Anomaly damage (switching out immediately upon entering Fluttering Frock state is the fastest possible method to do this).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When it comes to combos, Vivian can use any combination of skills that generate 2 or 3 Flight Feathers to reach a total of 4 or 5 to ultimately convert. Make sure not to waste any Flight Feathers however, as you would lose potential Abloom activations otherwise, so only use Ultimate on Vivian if she’s devoid of these resources.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Regarding her position in the meta, Vivian is an Agent who is heavily dependent on other Anomaly Agents’ Anomaly DMG and Anomaly Proficiency stats to perform.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" She is capable of dishing out amazing Anomaly DMG in the right team, whether that is through Corruption, Disorder, or Abloom. Generally speaking, all 3 of these damage sources, on top of the damage provided during her on-field time, make her stand out as a comfortable high to top tier character who is able to slot in any Anomaly Agent’s team and perform at least decently well to very effectively, especially if that Anomaly Agent is meant to stay on the field during the majority of combat. Check out our Teams section for a more in-depth look on this!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Generally speaking, Vivian is an Agent who’s simple to play and build, who can perform very well in low-cost teams and with a low-cost W-Engine, which doesn’t require a lot of premium resources put into them.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" She, however, does hold some big vertical upgrades that can be considered to enhance team performance if necessary. Her main weakness is undoubtedly her reliance on Assist Follow-Ups to have the highest possible Flight Feather generation, as well as adapting her combos dynamically based on the amount of Flight Feathers you can generate and convert in the moment. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Additionally, Vivian’s damage isn’t just dependent on her stats but other characters’ which means everyone in the team will require good investment in terms of Disc Drives","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". However if players can manage this, they will find a lot of success with Vivian as she is one of this game’s top-performing Anomaly Agents.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To summarize, Vivian is an Anomaly DPS Agent that lots of players can draw high performance out of. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pairing her with a second Anomaly Agent is mandatory for her to reach her full potential, but she has lots of options to cover for this, meaning building a team around her is not difficult. She sports great damage with dynamic combos and is able to buff any Anomaly Agent’s damage to great lengths, all of these factors securing her a high spot in the Zenless Zone Zero meta.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dynamic SubDPS-style kit with lots of Anomaly DMG that can be triggered from on and off-field;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Damage scales directly with Anomaly DPS strength — the more Anomaly damage your DPS does, the better she becomes;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Flexible character: has room for optimizations while being strong at a baseline, has lots of teams to choose from;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very F2P-friendly — competitive F2P team and build options, any player can make good use out of Vivian.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her own damage depends on the stats of your other Anomaly Agents, which can be expensive to build;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies on Perfect Assists to make the best use of her kit, making her enemy-dependent to an extent;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Other characters substitute her role in a team effectively in spite of her unique mechanics.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Abloom Anomaly damage, which makes up most of her DPS, increases directly with how much Anomaly Proficiency she has. This means she favours this stat over ATK% in almost all situations.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > ATK = PEN

talents.name: Walking Into the Orchard in Spring
talents.desc: When a total of 4 Guard Feathers are consumed, gain 1 Flight Feather. All Attribute Anomaly DMG and Disorder DMG received by targets under Vivian's Prophecy increases by 16%.

talents.name: Stormy Night, Stormy Night
talents.desc: Vivian's Ether Anomaly Buildup Rate increases by 25%. The benefits of Abloom from Anomaly Proficiency are raised to 130% of the original value, and 15% of the target's All-Attribute RES is ignored.

talents.name: Another and the Same
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: The Wind Between the Reeds
talents.desc: Basic Attack: Fluttering Frock - Suspension and Basic Attack: Featherbloom will always CRIT on hit, and they will also increase Vivian's ATK by 12% for 12s. Repeated triggers reset the duration. When entering the battlefield, Vivian immediately gains 5 Guard Feathers.

talents.name: Sonnet
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Vivian
talents.desc:
Vivian's Ether DMG increases by 40%. When triggering a Perfect Dodge during Basic Attack: Noblewoman - Waltz's dash, or using EX Special Attack: Violet Requiem, gain 1 additional Flight Feather.
Launching Basic Attack: Fluttering Frock - Suspension consumes all Guard Feathers, the downward attack's area of effect increases, and upon hit, triggers a special instance of Abloom. Each additional Guard Feather consumed will increase the proportion of additional Anomaly DMG dealt by that instance of Abloom, consuming a maximum of 5 Guard Feathers to increase the DMG up to a maximum of 5 times the original.

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yanagi is an S-Rank Melee Electric Anomaly Agent who serves as a main field Anomaly DPS and specializes in dealing and amplifying Disorder damage. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Traditionally, Disorder first requires you to have an Anomaly on an enemy and then trigger another one of a different type to activate. However, what makes Yanagi unique is her ability to completely bend these rules with her special mechanic “Polarity Disorder” which she can access via her Ultimate or EX-Special Attack.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Polarity Disorder allows Yanagi to trigger a “mini” Disorder on demand ignoring enemies Anomaly build-up and also whether current Anomaly on the enemy is different from Yanagi’s own","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" (Yanagi being an Electric Agent can trigger Polarity Disorder on Shock). This singular part of her kit alone carves out a place for her in the endgame meta as one of the strongest Anomaly DPS in the game, but of course that’s far from all she has to offer.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her playstyle is straightforward but challenging to master, as it features multiple buffs to keep active, many different combos, and when played in Disorder teams a lot of Character-Swaps and Anomaly management.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Outside of Polarity Disorder, the other mechanic that makes her stand out is a special stance mechanic. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yanagi has two stances, “Jougen” Stance and “Kagen” Stance which she can freely swap between. Each stance changes her Basic Attack pattern and grants her a buff while active. Stances can be swapped through the use of a Special Attack or EX-Special Attack and doing so will allow Yanagi to retain the buff from her previous stance for 8 seconds on top of gaining the buff of the stance she just entered.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Getting both buffs at once is a great incentive for swapping between stances already, but the benefits don’t end there.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Swapping between stances also allows her to execute combos faster and activate her must-use Additional Ability “Gesso”. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With all that said, the game plan is: to Swap Stances, execute shortened combos, maintain all buffs, use EX Special’s and Ultimates to trigger Polarity Disorder and manage team Anomaly to trigger standard Disorders as you would in any normal Anomaly team. Sounds pretty easy right? Not so much… ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Well fortunately it’s not quite as complicated as it sounds so let's dive into the nitty gritty of her kit to break it down.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yanagi’s Basic attacks are at the heart of most of her combos and as we’ve learned she has two different sets - one for each of the stances. Which stance you’re currently in and which buffs you have active can be tracked in the top left of the screen (If both sides are lit up you have both buffs!).","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Each set of Basic Attacks consists of a 5-part combo including 2 Physical Attacks (Basic 1 and 2) and 3 Electric Attacks (Basic 3, 4 and 5). Both stance combos take roughly the same amount of time to execute, but there are some slight differences regardless, excluding the buffs you gain in each stance. Here is what to look out for:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Jougen Stance:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Full Basic Attack combo does slightly more damage and Anomaly build-up.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Grants Anti-Interrupt Level during Basic Attacks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"10% increased Electric DMG in stance and for 8 seconds after leaving.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Kagen Stance:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Full Basic Attack combo does slightly less damage and Anomaly build-up.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Grants Interrupt Level Increase against enemies.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"10% increased PEN Ratio% in stance and for 8 seconds after leaving.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For those looking to min-max, spending more time in “Jougen” Stance over “Kagen” Stance offers a slight edge,","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" however the main priority should be always keeping both stance buffs active first and foremost instead.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With min-maxing in mind, Basic Attacks 1 and 2 in both combos being Physical Attacks are not ideal to use as they don’t apply Electric Anomaly build-up. Fortunately, a large majority of her abilities all feature a condition that using Basic Attacks immediately after them allows her to skip both completely and execute Basic Attacks 3,4 and 5 immediately instead. Here’s the list of abilities that allows the streamlining of both Basic Attack combos:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dodge Counter: Rapid Retaliation","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Chain Attack: Celestial Harmony","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ultimate: Raiei Tenge","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Special Attack: Ruten","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX-Special Attack: Gekka Ruten","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Quick Assist: Blade of Elegance","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assist Follow-Up: Weeping Willow Stab","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As can be seen above there are a lot of ways to perform the Basic Attack skip and you should prioritize ensuring you always do it to maximize damage. Here is an example of a common attack sequence:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dodge Counter: Rapid Retaliation","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Now that we know most of her combos and how stances work, swapping stances and dealing massive damage via Polarity Disorder is next and both are associated with her Special Attacks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Unlike most characters, Yanagi's standard Special Attack is actually incredibly useful. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Not only using it allows her to immediately Swap-Stance at any time but if it was used following either Basic Attack 3, 4 or 5 of standard combo, she’ll Swap-Stance faster, can continue her streak in her newly entered stance and also gain a small animation speed boost, here’s how it can be used to continually a combo endlessly:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Special Attack: Ruten","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Special Attack: Ruten","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Using the Special Attack to juggle back and forth between stances is a surefire way to keep her most powerful attacks flowing freely and all buffs active.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With enough Energy (40) pressing and holding the Special Attack will activate her EX-Special Attack: Gekka Ruten causing her to perform a two-part attack consisting of a Thrusting Dash and Downward Smash dealing tremendous Anomaly build-up and most importantly, triggering Polarity Disorder. Polarity disorder occurs the moment the smash lands and it behaves similarly to a standard Disorder but instead only deals 15% of the usual damage.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" However, it has another special base damage multiplier added to it - equalling to 3200% of Yanagi’s Attribute Proficiency (at max rank). ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"The mix of these multipliers ensures decently damaging hits but also has the upside of triggering huge Disorders through Burn, Shock, and Corruption Anomalies when played right. As a difference from the norm and as an added bonus - Polarity Disorder ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"will not","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" remove the Anomaly from the enemy. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In addition to Polarity Disorder, using her EX-Special Attack also grants her the “Shinrabanshou state” for 15 seconds. While in the “Shinrabanshou state” whenever Yanagi uses Basic Attack 5 she’ll immediately be able to execute Basic Attack 3 right after without any assistance. You’ll have this buff up a good amount of combat making her optimal Basic Attack combo just that much more consistent.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Similar to her standard Special Attack Yanagi’s EX also changes her stance on use but unlike the standard one, this allows her to move straight into Basic Attack 3 regardless of what came before it making it a good tool to start your Basic Attack combo if no other abilities with the signature effect are available. With enough energy available combos like the following are possible:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Gekka Ruten (Enter Shinrabanshou state)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The other ability that can trigger Polarity Disorder is her Ultimate, which does damage at the same rate of 15% of Disorder and 3200% of Attribute Proficiency -  making it worth using if you can spare the team's Decibels, but not mission critical for her gameplan. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Outside of triggering Polarity Disorder her Ultimate is very standard, primarily offering a tremendous amount of Electric Anomaly.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The rest of Yanagi’s kit including her Dodge Counter, Chain Attack, Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up are all simple direct damage strikes that apply a strong amount of Anomaly Build-Up but lack any special effect outside of skipping Basic Attack 1 and 2. All are worth using if the situation arises but none are core to her rotation or gameplan; use them at your discretion as they’re available.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Rounding off her kit is her Core Passive: Lunar Eclipse, which increases the base multiplier of Disorder damage from 450% to 700% (at max rank) for the whole squad for 15 seconds when using her EX-Special attack. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"How impactful this bonus will be depends on the Anomaly Disorder you’re triggering, but it’s always worth keeping active. As an added benefit after striking an enemy with her EX she also increases the Electric Damage% against them by 20% for 15 seconds doubling up on the buff value.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lastly,","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" her Additional ability grants her a 45% Electric Anomaly build-up increase on the first Basic Attack she does following a stance change lasting for 8 seconds.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" This buff timing lines up perfectly with the lingering benefits of each stance making maintaining it no extra effort for what is ultimately a huge boost.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To conclude, Yanagi cheats the system by being able to access Disorder at any time with no strings attached regardless of team composition, can infinitely string together high Anomaly Basic Attack combos making for excellent sustained damage regardless of resources, can amplify her own (and the team) Disorder multipliers and has incredible burst on demand if you’re willing to pull out all the stops. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Overall, while is a bit challenging to play, and wants a good amount of field time to facilitate her Basic Attack sequences and Stance-Swaps, the payoff is well worth the investment if your team can work alongside her.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}
