build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Know Thy Self, Know Thy Enemy
talents.desc: When any squad member inflicts an Anomaly on an enemy, Yanagi gains 1 stack of Clarity, lasting 15s, stacking up to 3 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration. Upon being hit by an enemy attack, Yanagi consumes 1 stack of Clarity to gain invulnerability for 1s. When Yanagi has 1 or more stacks of Clarity, her Anomaly Proficiency increases by 80.

talents.name: Outstanding Adaptability
talents.desc: During her EX Special Attack, the rapid thrust's Electric Anomaly Buildup increases by 20%. Holding down the Special Attack button after a rapid thrust hits an enemy will consume 10 additional Energy to launch another thrust. If Energy is insufficient or the button is released, the attack automatically follows up with the downward attack. When the downward attack hits an enemy suffering an Anomaly and triggers Polarity Disorder, the DMG multiplier increases to 20% of the original Disorder effect. Each additional thrust increases this multiplier by 15%, up to a maximum of 2 extra thrusts.

talents.name: Tsukishiro Style Management
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chessmaster
talents.desc: When Yanagi inflicts Attribute Anomaly DMG on an enemy, they suffer the Exposed effect, lasting 15s. Attacks on enemies under the Expose effect will have 16% increased PEN Ratio.

talents.name: Other Mother
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Inhuman Blood
talents.desc: After a thrust attack during her EX Special Attack, the duration of the Shinrabanshou state increases to 30s. While the state is active and her EX Special Attack DMG increases by 20%. The maximum number of times the additional DMG multiplier increase effect for Polarity Disorder in Outstanding Adaptability can be triggered increases to 4, and the Energy cost for the first 4 additional thrust attacks is halved.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yixuan is an S-Rank Auric Ink Agent belonging to the brand new Rupture class who specializes in breaking enemy defenses to deal massive Sheer Force damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yixuan is an Agent packed with several unique mechanics that make her stand out from her peers as she possesses a completely separate kit & playstyle from any Agents we’ve seen before. She remains simpler to put in practice, but explaining her kit will require us to tackle a lot of new terminology.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"First of all, since the Rupture class is new, we’ll take some time to introduce it. Rupture Agents deal damage based on a new stat called Sheer Force. In Yixuan’s case, she gains Sheer Force both through increasing her ATK and her HP (the latter of which is more favourable for her).","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" A certain percentage of these stats is converted into Sheer Force.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" In the case of Yixuan, she converts 10% of her HP and - applicable to all Rupture Agents - she also converts 30% of her ATK into Sheer Force (however this is less favourable for her than HP).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"All Sheer DMG completely ignores enemy DEF, meaning PEN and DEF-related stats are completely ignored on Yixuan -","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" they functionally don’t influence her damage at all. This means Support Agents like Rina and Nicole, or even Trigger’s Signature W-Engine have their effectiveness greatly negated and aren’t worth using with Yixuan on the team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yixuan’s Energy is replaced by Adrenaline, they serve the same purpose but function differently. At a default regeneration rate of 2 per second, Energy Regen buffs become ineffective, from Disk Drives to Agent buffs. She restores Adrenaline in a few ways, which we will recap after introducing her abilities one by one.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When Yixuan consumes Adrenaline, she restores a golden bar below her in-battle character icon called Technique (at a rate of 2/3 of her Adrenaline). When she reaches 120 Technique (180 Adrenaline consumed), she can use a special Ultimate called “Endless Talisman Suppression” which deals massive damage to enemies. This does not consume any Decibels, used separately for a more powerful Ultimate called “Qingming Skyshade”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Final specialty inherent to her class, very similarly to Miyabi’s Frost element, Yixuan’s unique Auric Ink element is functionally the same as Ether ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- however, it has its own Anomaly bar which, once filled, restores Adrenaline for Yixuan and triggers Auric Ink Corruption (functionally the same as Ether Corruption). For this reason of filling this Anomaly meter but also several abilities that take a while to execute, while restoring Adrenaline efficiently, she will generally want to remain active on the field for extended periods of time in order to cast as many Ultimates as possible (we’ll also throw in the reminder that Decibel generation is significantly faster for the on-field Agent, so it all plays in Yixuan’s favour).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With all of these mechanics explained, we’re finally ready to explain her attacks in detail. Yixuan’s primary took in her kit is her EX Special, so let’s explain that first:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It has three separate versions: the first, accessed by simply pressing EX Special with enough Adrenaline, causes her to do a 3-part attack: the first costs 40 Adrenaline, the second costs 0, and the third costs 20. In order, they are called “Ink Manifestation”, “Celestial Cloud Blitz - Break” and “Qingming Eruption - Break”. However, it’s possible to hold EX Special to enter a Parry stance. When a successful parry (called “Perfect Block”) is triggered against an enemy attack, it activates Ink Manifestation and a follow-up multiplier (called a “talisman attack”), which can optionally be followed up by the other 2 EX Specials in the sequence. This negates the DMG from the attack received and refunds Yixuan’s Adrenaline by 10.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Finally, the third EX Special called “Cloud Shaper” is activated by holding Basic Attack, which consumes up to 60 Adrenaline and deals similar damage to the first two attack sequences if fully charged, in which case it automatically triggers another attack called “Ashen Ink Becomes Shadows”. However, it’s preferable to use this version during Stun, as it deals 30% increased damage to enemies. Outside of Stun, this EX Special can be ignored.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We already explained her two Ultimates prior, however it is worth noting using them also makes her enter the Meditation state, which increases her CRIT DMG by 40% for 15s, which is a small boost to her damage. It is also worth noting the Technique point Ultimate restores an “Auric Ink Point” for her, visible to the right of her Technique gauge. It can be consumed by holding Dodge either after an EX Special sequence or an Ultimate to quickly access it, or it can be accessed on its own, which casts a special Basic Attack called “Auric Array” and is automatically followed up by “Qingming Eruption” which deals high damage and recovers a big chunk of Adrenaline.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lastly, an additional effect of her Decibel Ultimate is that it redistributes HP evenly across party members, allowing Yixuan to heal injured teammates or heal herself if she is injured, at the cost of the others’ HP.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now that all of this is explained, let’s detail how Adrenaline is restored so that we can discuss key gameplay elements and conclude this review. Yixuan restores:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" 2 Adrenaline per second passively;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"10 Adrenaline from parrying with her EX Special;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"5 Adrenaline from a Perfect Dodge;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"5 Adrenaline from switching her out and performing a Perfect Assist;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Adrenaline per second for 10 seconds after any Squad Member uses an Ultimate (this does not stack, the duration of this effect can only be refreshed);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"10 Adrenaline for applying the Auric Ink Corrosion Anomaly;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"7 Adrenaline per second for 3 seconds after casting Auric Array by consuming an Auric Ink Point.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Note that this means her Perfect Dodges and Assists are important to Adrenaline regeneration. If Yixuan switches out and her squad member performs a Perfect Assist as a result, she triggers a lightning strike attack of her own while restoring Adrenaline. The more aggressive the enemy you face, the better Yixuan can respond and the more effective her kit becomes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yixuan’s Basic Attacks have some mechanics which are worth detailing as well:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After a Quick Assist or Dodge Counter, Yixuan can follow up with Basic Attack stage 4.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After a Dash Attack, Yixuan can follow up with Basic Attack stage 3.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Without an Auric Ink Point available, Yixuan can still use Basic Attack: Ink-Veil Cloud Coalescence by holding Dodge and switch out of the field for lots of off-field damage. The animation & damage are fully performed and Yixuan even automatically follows up with Basic Attack stage 5 — however note it prevents Yixuan from properly performing Perfect Assists and Dodge Counters, so use this sparingly (in which case the Dash Attack or Quick Assist combos will be preferred).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yixuan’s Chain Attacks, Dodges and Assists are very similar to other Agents in functionality aside from the significant aid Dodges and Assists provide in restoring Adrenaline for Yixuan, but note her Chain Attacks are a noteworthy part of her damage nonetheless. Additionally, holding the Dodge button while inputting a directional input allows her to enter the Light as Air state which significantly enhances her movement — great for chasing down enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"So fundamentally, her gameplay sums up to the following:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Prepare Adrenaline for your Stun windows so you can use EX Specials during it;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While on field, perform at least 1 sequence of EX Specials while parrying an enemy attack in order to restore Technique for your Stun window;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Accumulate daze on the enemy and perform Perfect Dodges and Assists;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ensure to utilize your Auric Ink Point and Ultimates from allies to restore Adrenaline;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ensure to build up Daze and upkeep buffs from Stun and Support Agents who are part of Yixuan’s squad;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"If nothing else can be done, use Basic Attacks while waiting for an opportunity to respond to the enemy;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"During Stun, unleash all your most powerful moves in quick succession: Chain Attacks, EX Specials and Ultimates for optimal damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This was a lengthy explanation, but it was necessary as Yixuan is not only the first Rupture-class Agent, she has a ton of unique mechanics that make her a standalone Agent who introduces a fresh way to enjoy Zenless Zone Zero combat.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Regarding her position in the meta, Yixuan is one of the top damage dealers in the game without a doubt. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whether she will live up to the expectations of the DPS powerhouse Miyabi and match up to her is a question that is difficult to answer (ironically also the case in the game’s lore). But it goes without saying that Yixuan is a top tier character, who can handle certain kinds of enemies better than Miyabi can, while Miyabi can handle certain kinds of enemies better than Yixuan can. Generally speaking, the more aggressive the enemy, the closer the gap between Yixuan and Miyabi becomes, to where Yixuan may even outdo her in some situations — all this comparison to say, she can be regarded as either the best or the second best damage dealer in the game, which is nothing but fitting of Yixuan’s importance to the lore of Zenless Zone Zero.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her main flaws lie in the fact that she is highly dependent on the enemy’s aggression in order to respond with Perfect Assists and Perfect Dodges, and she is also dependent on specific teammates ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"and builds as she benefits more from HP than ATK and she does not benefit from Energy Regen-related buffs (Adrenaline being counted as separate), and both PEN and DEF-related stats also have no effect on her which restricts teammate options. However, so long as her team complements her perfectly (and the enemy isn’t a punching bag), she’s one of the most well-rounded Agents capable of handling most situations brilliantly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In conclusion, Yixuan is a complex Agent who introduces a bunch of new mechanics and with them, a bunch of damage potential, in spite of a couple key flaws that need to be taken into account to make her shine.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Nonetheless, if Proxies can adapt to her uniqueness, in the right hands, she will be able to perform as one of the top damage dealers in Zenless Zone Zero, justifying her position as a top-tier character.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Massive Sheer DMG potential, one of the highest in the game;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP Scaling Agent, which means really high HP to tank enemy attacks, on top of her Ultimate redistributing HP evenly between teammates to ensure survivability;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Unique element with unique kit mechanics and several ways to optimize her playstyle — has a lot of depth to the way you can play her with many combos available, her playstyle is highly flexible;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy to chase moving targets thanks to her enhanced movement capabilities;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate animations though…","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Reliant on specific key Agents who complement her kit perfectly — has trouble finding viable alternatives due to scaling primarily off of HP, wanting to stay on the field and ignoring DEF/PEN/Energy Regen-related stats;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Enjoys being able to respond to enemy mechanics to trigger Perfect Blocks, Assists, and Dodges. The less aggressive the enemy is, the worse she becomes;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"How will Hoyoverse top off her Ultimate animations?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"SHEER FORCE: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2100 - 2400","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1800 - 2000+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"16,000 - 18,000+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"600+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"80 - 90%","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Including Disc Drive Bonus)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"140 - 160%","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT Rate = CRIT DMG > HP% > ATK% > Flat HP

talents.name: Spiritual Path
talents.desc: Upon entering combat, CRIT Rate increases by 10% and immediately gain 120 Technique Points. In Investigation Zone Mode, this effect can only trigger once every 180s. When any squad member lands a hit on an enemy, Yixuan automatically summons an extra lightning strike, dealing DMG equal to 50% of her Sheer Force and restoring 5 additional Adrenaline. This can trigger once every 6s.

talents.name: Ward Off Misfortune
talents.desc: When an Ultimate or EX Special Attack deals DMG, it ignores 15% of the target's Ether RES; Triggering Ultimate: Qingming Skyshade extends all enemies' Stunned state by 3s, enemies can only be affected by this effect once per Stunned state, and similar effects cannot stack; Additionally, when using Ultimate: Endless Talisman Suppression, gain one stack of Condensed Ink effect. After Basic Attack: Qingming Eruption or EX Special Attack: Ashen Ink Becomes Shadows, press the Basic Attack button, or after EX Special Attack: Qingming Eruption - Break, press the Special Attack button to launch EX Special Attack: Endless Talisman Suppression - Break, dealing DMG up to 1,200% of Sheer Force. Only one stack of Condensed Ink can be held at a time.

talents.name: Cycle of Yin and Yang
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Assist, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2.

talents.name: The One Path of Mysticism
talents.desc: Activating an Ultimate grants one stack of Tranquillity, up to a max of 2 stacks. For each stack of Tranquillity, the next EX Special Attack: Cloud-Shaper DMG and EX Special Attack: Ashen Ink Becomes Shadows DMG increase by 30%.

talents.name: Calm Sky Vigil
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Assist, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2.

talents.name: Swift Yet Still
talents.desc: After using Ultimate: Qingming Skyshade, gain a stack of the Regulated Breathing effect. While under this effect, you can ignore the Technique Point cost to launch Ultimate: Endless Talisman Suppression once. The Regulated Breathing effect ends after Ultimate: Endless Talisman Suppression is used. This effect can only be gained once every 30s. Only one stack of Regulated Breathing can be held. Additionally, while in the Meditation state, Yixuan's Sheer DMG is increased by 20%.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Zhu Yuan is a Ranged/Melee hybrid S-Rank Ether Combat Agent specializing in delivering massive Ether Burst damage to stunned enemies with her unique ammunition system","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". With her high mobility, Zhu Yuan integrates multiple Dash attacks into her optimal damage combos, allowing her to reposition mid-attack and implement Invulnerability frames while dealing optimal damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s kit revolves around her Shotgun Shell gauge, which can hold up to 9 Enhanced Shells. These shells empower her Basic and Dash Attacks. She switches between two modes of attack: Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Assault Mode","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": This mode includes most of her Default Attack sequences. It deals low damage but focuses on generating Enhanced Shotgun Shells.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Suppressive Mode","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": This mode features high-damage Charged Attacks. It can be accessed by holding down the basic attack, causing Zhu Yuan to perform a backflip before entering Suppressive Mode. In this mode, while holding, Zhu Yuan continuously consumes 1-3 Enhanced Shotgun Shells to deal massive damage with her attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan has some of the most varied combos available in the game, with each offering unique benefits in different situations. Learning and mastering them all is quite a challenge. Fortunately, it’s possible to focus on the most commonly used, highest-damage combos, which this guide will cover. Zhu Yuan has access to two completely different basic attack combos, one for each Suppressive and Assault mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks consist of a six-part attack combo (despite the game only listing five of the six parts). Here is the breakdown of the combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P1: Physical Melee Kick","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P2: Ether Ranged Shotgun Blast","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P3: Physical Melee Multi-Kick","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P4: Ether Ranged Shotgun Jump Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P5: Ether Ranged Shotgun Dash Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P6: Ether Ranged Shotgun Slide","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The most valuable attacks in this sequence are Basic P4 and P5, as they deal the best damage and also generate Zhu Yuan's shells. Ideally, we’d like to access these as frequently as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Another unique aspect of Zhu Yuan’s basic attacks is that she can weave in a Dash Attack after any of the combo sequences above by triggering a Basic Attack by holding down the directional key. In this guide, we’ll be talking specifically about her left and right Dash Attacks (they’re the same as each other), as they are the most effective in her kit and the ones you should be using whenever mentioned. Dashing after attacks in this way will alter the sequencing of her next attack depending on which you dashed after. Here is a list of how using a side dash after each part of the Assault Mode basic attack changes things:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P1 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P2 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P3 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P4 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P5 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P5 -> Dash Attack -> Loop to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P6 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The changes to attack ordering allow Zhu Yuan to execute higher damage, faster combos that generate more shells. Here is an example of a combo in action:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P1","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"By using Dash Attacks, we can speed up Zhu Yuan’s standard rotation and loop/skip to the best parts of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s other Basic Attack moves are within Suppressive Mode, which, as mentioned above, needs to be entered by holding down the Basic Attack and waiting for Zhu Yuan to perform a short preparatory flip. The time needed for Zhu Yuan to enter Suppressive Mode is roughly 0.5 seconds, long enough that you don’t want to be constantly moving in and out of Assault and Suppressive unless necessary. The best approach is to enter Suppressive mode only when you have sufficient Enhanced Shells to consume (5 or 9 being optimal). Additionally, several abilities in Zhu Yuan’s kit allow her to immediately enter Suppressive Mode without delay as long as you immediately begin using Suppressive Mode Basics right after they finish. These abilities are:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After entering Suppression mode, continuously holding down the Basic Attack will cause Zhu Yuan to fire an Enhanced Shotgun combo consisting of 3 parts which if available, will each consume a number of Shotgun Shells to deal either tiny Physical (un-enhanced) or massive Ether damage (enhanced). Due to the poor multipliers on Zhu Yuan’s un-enhanced Suppressive Basics it’s never worth using them without Shells available. Here is how many Shells each attack uses:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 = 1 Shell","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 = 1 Shell","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 = 3 Shells (Deals triple the damage of P1 and P2)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Just like Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks, she can also make use of a special Suppressive Mode Dodge Attack to alter and improve her Basic Attack sequences. We’ll again be making use of side Dash Attacks (left and right) as they are the most competitive in most cases. Here is how dashes affect the combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (Loop)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The key takeaway here is that we can use a Suppressive Mode Dash Attack following a Suppressive Mode Basic P3 to skip straight back to another P3 incredibly quickly, allowing us to consume our Shells much faster and increase Zhu Yuan’s burst potential. Here is an example combo that dumps all 9 Shells as fast as possible (a full gauge):","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (3 Shells) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Dash Attack (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3  (3 Shells)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned above, Zhu Yuan has a Dash Attack for both Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode. For both modes, she has different Dash attacks for forward, back, left and right, but left and right are primarily used in both modes for her combos. They can be not only used mid-combo for cancels but also in general combat outside of combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Dodge Counter is a quick Shotgun Blast that deals Ether damage and generates 1 Shotgun Shell, making it an optimal way to stack up Shells quickly against fast-attacking enemies. Following this Dodge Counter, Zhu Yuan skips straight to her Assault Mode Basic P3, allowing her to quickly chain attacks together if desired.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up both launch a Shotgun Blast dealing Ether damage and generating Shotgun Shells. Her Quick Assist generates 1 Shell and her Assist Follow-Up generates 3.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, and Ultimate are all functionally the same but with varying damage multipliers. All of them trigger massive Shotgun Blasts that immediately place Zhu Yuan in Suppressive Mode allowing for immediate usage of Suppressive Mode Basics and generating 3 Shells each.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To round off her kit, Zhu Yuan features an incredible Core Passive as well as an Additional Ability, both of which tremendously boost her damage output. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Core Passive boosts the damage of all her Shell-Enhanced Suppressive Mode Basic Attacks and Dash Attacks by up to 40%, further increasing against Stunned targets by another 40% for a total of 80%. She also gains 6 Shells at the start of each combat. Meanwhile, with her Additional Ability if Zhu Yuan has a Support character or a character sharing either her Faction in the team, she’ll gain 30% Crit Rate for 10 seconds after using an EX Special, Chain, or Ultimate. This buff is all but guaranteed to be permanently active during Zhu Yuan’s main burst window where she unloads all her Shells (usually against Stunned enemies). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s build-and-spend kit plays perfectly into a Burst damage playstyle where she can build up Shells, Energy, and her Ultimate to unleash strong attacks on Stunned enemies in an incredibly short amount of time. At the time of her release, Zhu Yuan delivers the most Burst damage during a Stun window in the game, assuming she has all her kit at her disposal.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan possesses exceptional mobility options that not only do not lower her damage but actually increase it, allowing her to reposition on the battlefield constantly and effectively.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Due to baked-in dash attacks in most of her attack sequences, Zhu Yuan gains small moments of invulnerability mid-combo, providing her with an edge in combat survivability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Good cleave-based hitboxes on almost all attacks for a character that is mostly ranged DPS.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan's damage output is significantly weaker when enhanced shells are not available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Heavily reliant on being paired with a Stun character in the team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Quick Reload
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan activates Chain Attacks/Ultimates, gain the Quick Reload effect. When Zhu Yuan has the Quick Reload effect and uses up all Enhanced Shotshells, the Quick Reload effect will be consumed to instantly gain 6/9 Enhanced Shotshells.

talents.name: Ether Ember
talents.desc: In Suppressive Mode, Zhu Yuan’s Anti-Interrupt level is increased and DMG taken reduced by 10%. When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, the target takes 10% more Ether DMG from Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower DMG, stacking up to 5 times and lasting for 5s. Each shot adds one stack of this effect, and repeated triggers reset the duration.

talents.name: Public Security Special Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ether Perforation
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, her Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower ignore 25% of the target’s Ether RES.

talents.name: Special Ops Experience
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Expanded Energy Pack III
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan consumes a total of 12 Enhanced Shotshells, she receives the Ether Afterglow effect, and the Energy cost of the next EX Special Attack is reduced by 30. Launching an EX Special Attack will consume Ether Afterglow and shoot an additional 4-bullet Ether Buckshot. Each extra bullet deals DMG equal to 220% of Zhu Yuan's ATK.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leader of Public Security's Criminal Investigation team, Zhu Yuan, standing by. You can come to me if you need any help. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
